name: Blank Park Zoo
address: 7401 SW 9th St, Des Moines, IA 50315, USA
reviews: Nicely sized zoo. Open all year round with fun events. Zoo brew on Wednesday nights let you check out the animals up close with a drink in hand. Fun times!

This is a great local zoo!      There are lots of exhibits to see, but it can still be covered in a couple of hours.

We visited on a mild winter day, and it was fantastic.    There was no crowd, and many of the animals were still active.   (Even the flamingos.)     There is a great indoor area and plenty of indoor viewing areas scattered outside to warm up in when needed.

Be sure to visit Barnaby, the ~80 year old tortoise.      He was very active despite his age, walked up to greet us, and began playing with a ball.     Amazing!
Great zoo. Even in the winter they have animals to see. I love that it is small enough to visit in about an hour. I don't need to be stuck halfway through a zoo with a tired 3 year old.
It is a small zoo, but well worth seeing. My sister and I took her kids and we had a blast looking at all the animals. Especially the red  panda.
Great zoo. Lots of well planned patches and exhibits. Not too large yet not a little hole in the wall zoo either.

name: Greater Des Moines Botanical Garden
address: 909 Robert D. Ray Dr, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: The Botanical Garden has many different plants and activities. Take a class, listen to live music, complete crafts, or plant your own garden. Check their calendar for upcoming events. There are always staff or volunteers ready to answer questions you may have. They have classrooms open with activities for children to do. They offer guided tours on the weekend, or just take the time to walk on your own.

Absolutely, completely LOVE this place. There were families playing Uno on the upper deck, children "hunting" for certain plants on a scavenger hunt, and people quietly sitting, reading a book while they absorbed the warmth, humidity, and light. This has become one of my favorite winter Iowa destinations, especially due to my "winter blues". It's an inexpensive therapy! Also, check out the back room. It's well hidden and lovely as well.

So much fun!! It was so pretty, and a great way to escape snowy Iowa for a day!! The plants and flowers were gorgeous. Loved learning about the plants, it was educational yet super fun. It had great places for younger children to learn. It was very clean, and the volunteers/staff were extremely friendly!! Can't wait to go again!!!

The plants all look cool. The inside is always larger in my memory, but there's plenty more around the perimeter. The views here are amazing as one would expect by the river and inside a gigantic glass dome. Check it out

I grew up going to the Botanical Center and I was so glad to come back to some beautiful updates to the facility. It is open all week (including weekends) from 10 am - 5 pm. There's so much veriety in the main garden and interesting fun facts. The waterfall is always wonderful and relaxing to sit next to and the upper balcony has been updated as well (some water drops from condensation). The original display from the front entrance is next to the bathrooms along with some really beautiful artwork. Tucked back by the orchids is a beautiful greenhouse display where there are a million photo opportunities.

name: Pappajohn Sculpture Park
address: 1330 Grand Ave, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: Very fun open area to walk around in, always something interesting to look at. Plenty of other places that are near by to go visit or eat at. Kid friendly, great spot for taking photos.
Nice place to visit while in Des Moines, it's a free park, just find any parking spot and you are good to go. Fun for everyone.
This is a unique collection of sculptures that will surprise you in downtown Des Moines. Nice setting and nice trendy food & drink nearby.
So glad that Des Moines has this space. Nice local restaurants close by as well. Nice to take an hour with the kids for something to do. And it is free looks all day everyday!

This place is incredible. Year round it looks nice, and the park keeps expanding with the space it has. It doesn't take much time to go through the entire park, but it makes a beautiful place to take food from the surrounding restaurants, or a nice place to read something from the nearby library. Speaking of which, everything surrounding the park is full of character and makes for a top notch experiance.

name: Iowa State Capitol
address: 1007 E Grand Ave, Des Moines, IA 50319, USA
reviews: Iowa State Capitol is a wonderful place. I loved the hospitality they provide in there. The way they have decorated the history and kept it alive is beautiful. I want to thank Marcia! She is very kind and she has got a great knowledge of the history. I enjoyed and I got to explore a bunch of new things that I had never done till now. Thank you! I highly recommend people to visit the beautiful place. You will have wonderful experience!

It's pretty good as far as capitals go. The gold is a nice touch with a lovely rotunda. It could use some updates as well as a better visitor entrance. The entrances are kind of hidden and appear as an afterthought, almost as if they are just stuck in wherever they fit instead of thinking of the visitor experience. Merchandise is reasonably priced but lacking in diversity of items.

Wonderful tour of the Iowa State Capitol with the Ray Society. One of the painters (restoration artists) explained how they have restored the plaster and painted walls throughout the bldg. Very impressive. Beautiful wood carvings, mosaics tile floors  and carpets. Dana was an excellent tour guide. Very knowledgeable about Iowa history. Only 5 domed capitol bldg in US and covered in gold leaf.

Beautifully preserved architecture throughout the Iowa State Capitol building. House of Representatives chambers are massive. Library is truly one-of-a-kind must see. Staff is gracious and welcoming. Great place to visit... just make sure to LOOK UP!!

The Capitol was a great experience. We had two little ones with us so we didn’t take the guided tour but we were still able to see almost everything. It has enough exhibits and things inside the building that you and the kids won’t get bored. If you want to go up to the highest levels of the gold dome then you need a tour guide but other than that you can basically do everything yourself. There are a ton of neighboring sites adjacent to the grounds as well as a gorgeous view of the city from up above, a rare site in flat Iowa. Definitely glad we took the time to go, it’s something we will return to visiting when the weather warms up.

name: Des Moines' Downtown Farmers’ Market
address: 400 Court Ave, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: Its always a motivation just to come out and mingle. Some of the best veggies crafts etc and love the wine tasting. Always spend more than I want and never stay on schedule when visiting so word of advice make it a day and stay ad long as you want a real plus.

Such an amazing farmers market! We would drive 30 min every week to go, its huge and has everything. Must try croissants or scones and bread at La Mie, or a breakfast burrito and some coffee! It's got everything: produce, canned salsa/jams, cheese, wine, meats, honey, juice, bakeries, arts and crafts, music, dog treats, and so much more. It's clean, safe, tons of entertainment, and port-o-potties for families/littles. Great location in the middle of restaurants (as if u couldn't find deliciousness at the market itself), can walk the bridge across the river. Best farmers market we've ever been too, and we've lived in 9 states.

Fantastic. Great place to walk around and interact with a wide group if people. From crafts, plants, food and everything in between. Was able to sample a lot of new food and took some home. Had some great stuffed fill pickles. There was beautiful music of all types. Everyone should check it out when ever possible. Truly amazing.

I love the November and December Farmer's Market. Though I preferred the previous location, the 2019 market iwas very enjoyable. It would be 5 stars if they would limit strollers to umbrella type. Most parents were carrying children and using strollers as grocery carts.1 family had a stroller baby/bed combo the size of big box store grocery cart.
Great people, one of the very best of Des Moines! Great for animals and children. We have some really talented vendors - awesome experience!

name: Gray's Lake
address: 2101 Fleur Dr, Des Moines, IA 50315, USA
reviews: Great place for a walk. Lots of trees and maybe you can see eagles or deer. I went to check our the new path to downtown. The bridge is nice but doesn't have great access for bicyclists at the north end. That narrow path is for bikes.

Very nice park! So cool. You could skateboard, bike, run,  walk, and walk you dog here around the circle lake. Animal and kid friendly. There are two bridges. They have many chairs if you need to sit right in the front. Soo cool. Totally fun and a great way to get exercise! Awesome!! It's hard to get parking though.   But otherwise AWESOME trail.

Great walking-biking trail, roughly 2 miles around Gray's Lake.  Parking in various lots around the lake.  Various Bike trails connecting to this trail.  Great brewery (Confluence), also adjacent to lake.
Nice park. Can't wait to enjoy it more. The lake is great. They have a cool walking path. Enjoy.

Such a wonderful public park. The nature trails and views are amazing. You can even get a great view of downtown. The bridge is beautiful. The staff at the desk are polite and helpful. The beach is kept clean during the summer time. Dogs are welcome. Waste cans everywhere to help us all keep it clean. VERY family friendly. Definitely another place to be proud of Des Moines for. ❤️

name: Des Moines Art Center
address: 4700 Grand Ave, Des Moines, IA 50312, USA
reviews:
I must say that the museum is exceptional and wonderful.  The atmosphere is incredibly calm and relaxed which allows you to appreciate all the pieces calmly and in your time.  The attention of the staff in all the rooms was first class, the ladies I asked for recommendations and information went beyond a simple instruction, which is quite appreciated because it shows that the staff loves their workplace.  The variety of pieces in the permanent exhibitions is amazing with pieces by international artists such as Picasso.  It has a restaurant inside the museum which allows you to enjoy a snack during your visit.  My recommendation is that you go on Thursdays as they close until late and it gives you the opportunity to observe the whole complex calmly.  Best of all, all this wonder is free!  So it is definitely a must-see gem when visiting Des Moines.

Debo decir que el museo es excepcional y maravilloso. La atmósfera es increíblemente tranquila y relajada lo que te permite apreciar todas las piezas con calma y a tu tiempo. La atención del personal en todas las salas fue de primer nivel, las señoritas a las que les pregunté recomendaciones e información para poder observar mejor las exposiciones fueron más allá de una simple instrucción, lo que se aprecia bastante porque se nota que el personal ama su lugar de trabajo y se agradece una atención sincera y amable. La variedad de piezas en las exposiciones permanentes es increíble contando con piezas de artistas internacionales y del nombre de talla como Picasso. Tiene un restaurante dentro del museo lo que te permite disfrutar de algún aperitivo durante tu visita. mi recomendación es que acudas en los jueves ya que cierran hasta tarde y te da la oportunidad de observar todo el complejo con calma. Lo mejor de todo es que toda esta maravilla es ¡gratis! así que definitivamente es una joya imperdible al visitar Des Moines.

The Des monies art center is a great place to see and experience,the building itself is a fantastic work of art! ❤️It is for all ages to enjoy.you could easily spend two hours there ❣️ 😀🖼 make sure to check out the lovely rose garden outside as well 🌹 🌹

Great place to unwind and really just retreat from the outside. The area is always quiet and easy to immerse oneself into the artwork. Staff are very friendly and knowledgeable and the area is kept clean. This place is a hidden gem.

Visiting from New Orleans I was introduced to the Art Center by a relative who lives here in DMI (Des Moines  IA). I was greeted at the door by ver nice people.  I was so taken by the art I almost touch it but you're not supposed to. Do not touch I felt like a kid when the attendee warned me.  I really had a great time walking around on each floor it's a maze within its self.  Really cool for any occasion.  #BUTTAFLIBEST1AWARD 🦋🏆

Such an underrated place.

Showcases popular artists like Pablo Picasso, John Singer Sargent, Edward Hopper, Georgia O'Keeffe, Grant Wood.

Admission has been free recently. The gift shop is one of my favorite places for gifts in Iowa. Please come here if you haven't already.

Everyone here is nice and social.

name: Salisbury House & Gardens
address: 4025 Tonawanda Dr, Des Moines, IA 50312, USA
reviews: This is a stunning place with amazing art as well as architecture and architectural craftsmanship. We visited today, Nov 12 and we went for the first tour. We had a wonderful and knowledgeable guide and we were the only ones there! A private tour! The guided tour is worth the extra expense as you will see more of the home and you will have docent guided tour with background and additional information. Whether you like textiles, paintings, pipe organs (amazing), sculpture or woodworking, you will delight in this amazing home. And we went with very cold weather and it was toasty warm! You will have stairs to climb. And there is parking. I cant say much about the gardens as it was all covered in a beautiful blanket of snow. This is a must see for locals and visitors. Enjoy!

Beautiful home built in the 1920s designed to reflect the architecture and feel of a manor seen in Salisbury UK. The home is furnished worn some replicas and some authentic 16th century architecture and furnishings. Some of the paintings on the wall are quite gorgeous. Tours of the full house are only offered three times a day, but you can pay $8 to walk around the first floor only. I opted to self guided tour which ended up being very few rooms and the front garden.

Phenomenal. Any one who loves history, England, or beauty should check it out. I was blown away. The story of the home and how it came to be is incredible to me. People with incredible sums of money these days would never build anything so amazing. A very unique find in the middle of Iowa.

I've always adore this place since I was a child and my mother would take me. Fun half day activity for children 12 and up. Great little piece of history to partake in. Always great to go back for a visit. I recommend always looking at the website for time and date information though, because they do events that may interfere with regular business hours. If your ever in Des monies I highly recommend.

We went to Mysteries at the Castle and had a great time with three of our kids. It was beautiful, fun and festive. The historic backdrop was delightful to show the kids and imagine with them how we would live there if it was our home. Will return to see the House when it is not a "Castle" :)

name: Science Center of Iowa & Blank IMAX Dome Theater
address: 401 W Martin Luther King Jr Pkwy, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: This is a location I wish I could visit more often with my son. It's fun, interactive and provides plenty of creative freedom in terms of activities. As an avid astrophotographer I especially enjoyed the IMAX dome theater  with a presentation of the night sky. There are plenty of activities to keep one occupied for an entire day and there should still be something to enjoy next time.

I love this place. It is/was my favorite place to be when I was a child and perhaps one of the early inspirations that led me to become the engineer that I now am. I would love for this place to grow, as it seems rather smaller than what I remembered as a child. In my honest opinion, the dome theater should be ditched and converted into an exhibit / virtual exhibit.
My children and I frequently come to The Science Center. The exhibits are fun interactive and educational. Something to do for all ages.

Fantastic Place for Kids!  Lots of hands on exhibits and a permanent Lego exhibit with large Lego models even adults can appreciate! Get your inner architect on with the build centers and test out some structures with the wind tunnel and the earthquake simulator!

My daughter works at our local science center and wanted to stop here during our vacation to see what Iowa has to offer. What a great place. There is so many things to do and see. We had a great time here.

name: Heritage Carousel of Des Moines
address: 1801 Pennsylvania Ave, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: Such a nice little spot to stop and visit. The lady running it that day was super sweet. The kids loved riding it over and over again. Very well kept. Clean and beautiful. Even us adults went on it and had a great time! Loved that you could see the little musical instruments going as you rode. Nice and shaded as well!
50 cents per child and the carousel is in fantastic shape.
This is my daughters favorite place in the summer. I enjoy taking her there frequently.
Enjoyed my time there only 50 for kids to ride good deal
Fun for all ages! The carousel has been around since I was a child in the 70s. It's in Eastside staple

name: World Food Prize Hall of Laureates
address: 100 Locust St, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: A beautiful building of purpose and great vision. Check the website for tours, and learn more about food security, along with some history of Des Moines. This used to be the old library, and comes with some stories as well!

It is informative, but read Desert. It's available for free online and can be accessed easily. This should be renamed to the Norman Borlaug BJ museum for what this really is. It feels far too much like it wants to celebrate billionaire philanthropy, US imperial hegemony, all packaged as if they're objective facts. "Norman Borlaug saved 1,000,000,000 lives. Wheat, rice, corn, and soybeans feed the most people across the world. The United States must accept a paternalistic role in the developing world."

Wow! Beautifully restored old library. It is a museum and a hall of fame honoring the achievements of individuals who have advanced human development by improving the quality, quantity or availability of food in the world. If you are into architecture this $29.8 million restoration project is definitely worth seeing!  The museum, located in the basement, is informative.  On the upper level there is a art room displaying works that relate to those that are honored in the Hall of Fame.  It is only open to the public on Tuesdays and Saturdays, but it is free.  I understand you can arrange a private tour on some other days during the week.  Located on the river, it is a must see if you are in Des Moines.

Amazing building, wonderful story about growing food! I'm picky, but I can't say enough about this place! [I'm straight A in 3rd World Social Development & Change (Sociology/Socioeconomics - UCSB)] I just happened to be renting a studio apt across the street. Lived there for two years before I even noticed the place!  When I visited it the experience was paranormal it was such a coincidence. Like I was brought there by some spirit or something. Amazing gardens and landscape with lots of rabbits and the Des Moines River flowing behind it. I witnessed people catching and cleaning Alligator Gar fish off the bridge. You never see this in CA where I'm from. Best experience for me in Iowa, so far was the World Food Prize Hall.
Love the architecture and the docent was very very helpful. The place is free and quite educational.

name: Rotary Riverwalk Park
address: 821 W River Dr, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews:
This is a nice walk and a suprisingly pleasent area.  Only 3 stars because Des Moines and much of the USA have this weird idea of isolating things rather than complimenting things.  This walk and the Asian park are isolated from other things.  In my humble opinion, the road the goes along the park near the Botanical center should accommodate businesses and shops.  A place to get a bite or a drink and/or some shops.  Its essentially a desert.  

You drive there.  You park.  You walk. That's it.  There is no place to get a bite or to shop.  Typical American desert of a park.
Lots to see. Des Moines is most definitely on the map. Great place to exercise, relax, & site see....

This was a very nice park and walking trail. 
The bridge is spectacular!
The Chinese garden is awesome! 
This is a hidden gem in Des Moines.
Wish is was warned to enjoy the park a little longer.
Spent a lovely lazy afternoon strolling around beautiful DSM.

A fairly recent artsy installation on the western bank of the Des Moines River in downtown Des Moines, right next to the western entrance to the iconic Iowa Women of Achievement Bridge.  When it first opened, there were a few more swings installed on the fishing pole, but when I visited this time, there was only one lonely swing left.  The park is nicely lit at night and adds a more "fun" element to the river front space in downtown.

name: Robert D. Ray Asian Gardens
address: Robert D. Ray Dr, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: One of our family favorite weekend walk area. Such a nice scene with flowers blooming in the spring, rock garden, river view, fall season also look amazing here, too. I really amaze at the architecture and designed of this place. Walking distance to botanical garden, women of achievement bridge, rotary riverbank park. I hope we raise enough fund to fix this place and get the ponds to work properly with Iowa weather. I think it's will look a lot better with the ponds and waterfalls completed.
Cool place to pull over and walk through. The pagoda is quite beautiful and affords a scenic view of the city across the river.
I'm sure it was beautiful at one time, but it's in a bit of disarray. With cleanup and straightening on the items in the garden in would be really nice. The location on the river is great.

It's a very pretty scenery to walk by on. But the river definitely worth walking by and viewing and makes for a pleasant walk. Also close to some other items to explore as well. May need some maintenance and weeding should be done but it was around fall areas and it wasnt bad. Overall the actual area is  cleaned and pretty.
Such a surprise to fin. Lovely little park to walk through. Peace and tranquility

name: Terrace Hill Historic Site
address: 2300 Grand Ave, Des Moines, IA 50312, USA
reviews: Toured with a small group and found the docent to be very knowledgeable and helpful and willing to look up info on questions she didn't know offhand.   The home is beautiful and although the tour is short, it's well worth it.  Lots of unique history behind this governor's mansion!

$5 donation for adults / $2.50 donation for kids 12 or younger. Tours are about an hour long. Includes short video on history of Terrace Hill and tour of first first 2 floors. Our your guide was very engaging and funny. Would recommend for anyone who wants to learn more about Iowa's history.
Great historic site to visit
This place is a must see if in Des Moines or just in Iowa. This is the Governor Mansion. Very beautiful.

This lovely is adjacent to August Home Publishing and directly across street East of Govenor Mansion -Terrace Hill Mansion -formerly The Hubbell Mansion-built by Mr Hubbell whom created Hubbell Reality a couple centuries ago!) 🙌👍😎

name: Adventureland Park
address: 3200 Adventureland Dr, Altoona, IA 50009, USA
reviews:
Definitely a fun location to take all ages during the summer.  They have rides for nearly anyone and they have a waterpark on-site.
   If you can afford to spring for the cost of Adventureland Inn and plan on staying the night it's worth it.  The trolley to and from the park that runs every 15 minutes or so is great.  You also save on parking doing it that way. The hotel has 2 pools and a sports bar inside that offers a great, affordable breakfast.  It's also a solid place for dinner but obviously there's cheaper hotels in the area.  But also plan ahead because the rooms can fill up fast.
   Since it's not one of the bigger parks the lines are typically much shorter.  Shorter lines make for a much better experience without having to pay extra for fast passes to get a quick line wait time.  This is definitely our goto amusement park but once our kids are a bit older we'll probably venture to a more exciting location with bigger attractions.  For younger kids Adventureland is great though.  I cant imagine the impatience in contrast.

Enjoy and hang on. Love the live shows, wave pools and slides. The Monster is worth the wait and the Phoenix was so much fun.  I would recommend buying your tickets online though because you can usually save a little money and you don't have to wait in line for tickets. The lockers for rent are very small, far to small to be practical.  I wouldn't have thought of amusement park as event space, but it was pretty cool being on the park grounds without a trillion other people. They have added a racetrack with mechanical horses that goes around a track.

I stay over. So hang at the wave pool then get some eats and back to the room come out later enjoy walking around and maybe hit a ride or 2. Prices are right and look for the coupons. Advetureland in consistent and friendly great staff.

Went with a group of four for the day. We had a lot of fun and got a chance to do almost everything. I do wish they would open a few ride for adults who dont love huge rides. My wife gets sick on roller coasters and feels she can only ride baby ride with the lack of other options. I hope they see this and maybe look into one for adults that's not so extreme.

The best destination for fun in the sun and thrills. Close to hotels shopping and Casino.  Save on parking by parking at hotel and riding the free shuttle.  Pack a picnic lunch for a mid day break. Enjoy and hang on.  Love the live shows, wave pools and slides.  Great family fun with discounted tickets at local grocery stores

name: State Historical Museum of Iowa
address: 600 E Locust St, Des Moines, IA 50319, USA
reviews: What a great place to see! A friend treated my son and I to a day trip and we LOVED this place! Very interesting displays with a lot of info about Iowa that I never knew(and I've lived here all my 55 years!).
The architecture and design of the building are interesting, the expositions inside the museum are simple but good and, if you read the information, you can learn something new about Iowa.

Wide variety of exhibits, from war memorabilia, to movies filmed in the state and more modern events, as well as history on the states expansion and development. Lots of history and items relating to the civil war, including personal effects of generals and soldiers who were from Iowa. Admission to the museum is free and there is a cafe located on the third floor.
Many interesting expositions about the history and culture in Iowa from various historic periods. Free entrance was a surprise.

I hadn't been here since I was a kid--what a mistake! My wife and son and I were just enthralled with the in-depth exhibits covering coal mining (as you walk through an elaborate coal mine), the Civil War, and the pre-European history of Iowa and much more. The Civil War exhibit really affected me; it really showcased the personal costs of the war. I will have to come back on my own to spend a day going through everything more thoroughly. We went with a big group of kids (ages 3-11) for 2 hours, and they had a great time as well.

name: Cowles Commons
address: 221 Walnut St, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: A concrete delight interwoven with circular sculptures which project moving images of the well-sculpted cyclist thighs spinning round and round for your infinite pleasure. Best visited at night for maximum cyclist-image visibility.
They really did a great job revamping this. I remember it was mainly an area for homeless people to hang out and usually bathe or soak. Brings in good food trucks now.
LOVE COMING HERE WITH MY CHILDREN!  Its beautiful at night and in the daytime, and there's a place to sit for adults or kids who dont want to play in the water.
Wonderful place to break for lunch. Nice fountain.
Not like the old days but still pretty. And relaxing. Was a great backdrop for when I took my daughters senior photos.

name: Raccoon River Park
address: 2500 Grand Ave, West Des Moines, IA 50265, USA
reviews: Love walking around this park. Some ice fishing in the winter and will be fun to swim at the beach in the spring. There is a great dog park, softball fields, archery.

Great place to take the family for a quiet and fun day. Playgrounds are clean and have many options for the kids to play on and keep busy. They have some good trails to walk on as well as run and bike. Lots of wild life roaming the woods. The trails have porta potties on them for ease of bathroom use. Very clean and well kept park. Good parking options and access to boat ramp and beach is a plus.

We love going to this place! Never had a bad experience! Its huge as well, they have a small and a large dog area but most people just use the large dog area. Its 20$ a year so it's pretty cheap and you need to supply your dogs shot record which is nice and reassuring! Only problem is, sometimes after it rains there's a lot of bugs. But other than we've had a great time!

One of the nicest, cleanest, well rounded parks I've been too. The trail around the lake is great to walk or run. The beach is perfect for kids and adults. And there's a busy house being built on the other end. Can't wait.
Always enjoy bringing our dogs here to walk. Plenty of open space and places to explore.

name: Walnut Woods State Park
address: 3155 Walnut Woods Dr, West Des Moines, IA 50265, USA
reviews: Walnut Woods State Park is as hidden gem. It is local and a beautiful location to be part of nature. The bird blind is a particularly wonderful aspect. To sit and watch the large number of feeders draw birds of all kinds, sizes, colors and with unique calls. Just give yourself a gift. Hike the trails, watch the birds and calm yourself.

The lodge is beautiful and can be rented for events. There are plenty of camp sites with power. The hiking trails are well maintained and offer views of the Racoon River. This is my favorite cross country skiing place after fresh snow. I would also say this is the best first day hike, as the snacks, hit cocoa, and REI folks are fantastic! A boat ramp is available and there are two entrances, with plenty of parking along the park drive. The newer playground features a rock with climbing, swings, sand, however it's in the sun and quite hot in the summer.
Same great place. Just a few road changes since 1995.
Very beautiful campgrounds, the beautiful trees. Very well kept grounds. Very peaceful. Bbq and picnic tables at every site.

We went to a party in the lodge (Western area) and loved it.  Nice heated space and fire in the winter and open outdoor area for warmer weather. Of course the woods are great for a hike.  Big space right in the city.

name: Ashby Park
address: 3200 38th St, Des Moines, IA 50310, USA
reviews: Great park, great improvements!!  ...  for all ages.  Pix are of area right behind the park.

A really nice park with a great splash pool! Lots of seating, and nice trees shading various seating spots.
There are changing rooms, and a bbqing facility there. I believe you can book this through the Parks department. 
Sufficient parking, with a walkway up to the splash pool.

Great, free spot to hang out with the kids!
It is a nice park!
Awesome for little kids.
Needs bigger rest room. Only 1 other than that its great. Free splash pad. Lots of shade.

name: Ashley Okland Star Playground
address: 1895 E McKinley Ave, Des Moines, IA 50320, USA
reviews: I actually came here for a photograph of Boston which ultimately came out stellar. It's a relatively well known spot for photographer's looking to get an image of Boston and it doesn't disappoint. It's a great park, well worth a walk around. If you park in the lot and you plan on getting a sunset photo, be careful, they do lock the gates after dark.

This park amazed me! It is so lovely. My children ages 3 and 4 absolutely LOVED it. This was one of those parks I had to bribe them to leave. There is parking and restrooms. They also have beautiful walking trails and after playing on the park we took a nice walk just the 3 of us and our pup love. My children made it through the entire trail and loved it. I left my phone and was a little nervous but felt safe enough to walk through the trail with kids. Not being from the area makes me nervous to go on hikes without my husband but here we felt safe and the beautiful hand built bridges over little water ways and an easier trail to take for the kids and I. Will definitely go back!

The kidlettes love this park.  It is highly maintained and the traffic (child count) stays relatively low.  It is the perfect park for kids of the younger sizes 2-5 and for bigger kids too 6-9ish. Bathroom facilities, swings, acres of manicured fields, local biking trails in/near the nearby woods, and disc golf adjacent the property.  There is a smaller secondary park across the highway (geared toward 4+) that is a great overflow playground, field, parking, etc.  

In the early mornings the park is usually very clean.  The ground crew mow early and frequently and are usually done by about 9am or so.  Occasionally a raccoon or two will get in the garbage, but very very rare.  Not a ton of seating , so bring a chair or blanket.  Also, if anyone reading this happens to have a spare plastic steering wheel, the park is missing two child's play steering wheels.

Oh hey, almost forgot; on one occasion,  someone dumped a truck load of used tires in the nearby creek adjacent the pedestrian bridge.  Not an issue that is too alarming for the Southside of DSM, but I here is the kicker; on a separate occasion (unrelated), open alcohol containers and an alarming number of crushed pills and residue were left on the green table under the walkway.   So that's a thing .
Mosquitoes too.

Lastly, make sure to assess the stacked hexigons as they accumulate water after rainfall.  Just FYI.

99% of the time this park is great.  Give it a shot. 🙂
Nice playground, and trails to explore. There is plenty of parking and a restroom available

The kidlettes love this park. It is highly maintained and the traffic (child count) stays relatively low. It is the perfect park for kids of the younger sizes 2-5 and for bigger kids too 6-9ish. Occasionally a raccoon or two will get in the garbage, but very very rare. Not a ton of seating , so bring a chair or blanket. Also, if anyone reading this happens to have a spare plastic steering wheel, the park is missing two child's play steering wheels.

Oh hey, almost forgot; on one occasion, someone dumped a truck load of used tires in the nearby creek adjacent the pedestrian bridge. Not an issue that is too alarming for the Southside of DSM, but I here is the kicker; on a separate occasion (unrelated), open alcohol containers and an alarming number of crushed pills and residue were left on the green table under the walkway. So that's a thing .
Mosquitoes too.

Lastly, make sure to assess the stacked hexigons as they accumulate water after rainfall. Just FYI.

99% of the time this park is great. Give it a shot.

name: Jasper Winery
address: 2400 George Flagg Pkwy, Des Moines, IA 50321, USA
reviews: Wine samples were small compared to other Iowa wineries I have visited.  The two I sampled were enjoyable. I purchased a glass for $7...that seemed a bit high.  Also they charge a corkage fee if you want to enjoy a bottle of their wine on premise. That was an incentive not to buy and enjoy there...that corkage fee was a first for me. I did purchase a bottle to enjoy at home.
A beautiful space, helpful staff, and delectable wines make this a perfect getaway for a date and some time to connect.
Beautiful location for weddings and events! Been there multiple times for the Amazing Wedding Race and it's loads of fun! Great staff and delicious 🍷 wine! Looking forward to Officiating here!
Excellent winery with beautiful grounds great wine and convenient location!

As a group, we felt completely unwelcomed and rushed through the tasting. Had to keep reminding server that we hadn't been served from the bottle she was rushing to put away. Samples were served in plastic cups, and the amount was so small it barely covered the bottom of the cup - very difficult to give it a good sniff or 2-3 sip tasting! Personally did not enjoy any of the wines (whites/rosés very sweet). First winery visit (of many) where I chose not to purchase a bottle(s). Outdoor grounds pretty, good sized patio.

name: Sleepy Hollow Sports Park
address: 4051 Dean Ave, Des Moines, IA 50317, USA
reviews: It's sad to watch a snowman melt... and messy.  Even so there were a few hearty Iowans attempting to enjoy the remnants of winter at Sleepy Hollow in spite of the slush and mud.  The workers I encountered were friendly.  The chalet looks nice.  Given another 12 inches of snow it might be worth the price.

I would say five stars, except that it cost sixty-nine bucks just for me and my Daughter to get through the gate.  That left me with very little cash for vendors.  Neither the event nor most of the vendors take credit cards.  If the park took credit cards (or charged a reasonable amount at the gate) I could have used my cash to buy souvenirs. I have several Friends who bend at Sleepy Hollow and they didn't make much (partially because of the turn-out, probably due to weather, but also because they charge exhorbitantly for vendor space, too).  Otherwise, it was a five star experience.

Suggestion:  Let vendors vend outside of the gate in the space between the bridge and the entrance and/or in the parking lot just before the bridge, too & charge them like half the amount.  That way patrons could shop on the way in and out...

I think Sleepy Hollow is awesome, especially for Iowa (we really don't have too many places like this so it's very nice). In the winter, you can go snowboarding or tubing down their huge hill with a lift that takes you back up. They have go-cart racing, mini-golf, and many other fun family activities!! I'm excited to go back out there to experience anything new. 
They also have events for holidays and such. One event I will be attending every year is the Renaissance Faire! Always held in September, and it's very fun. They have an AMAZING Halloween event as well; the last time I attended was a few years back, but it had 3 main attractions and they were super scary and super fun!! In the winter they have the activities named above (might have new things now too!).

Over all this place has some potential. The staff I engaged with was extremely nice. It was very once that they have everything you need there, including boots for a few extra dollars. 

Only half the area had snow on it. I was told it's because it has been to warm and they needed it to be below 27 degrees to make snow. I found this odd because it has been below that temp for several days prior to visiting. They still charge full price even though only half of the place is available. 

It seemed a little crowded because of the lack of snow, but lots of people. The slope was a little aggressive for young beginners and I seen a few people, including my son get hurt. If they had more snow and some beginner/learning slopes that would have been helpful. 

Would I go back? Sure, but not anytime soon, maybe if we are back in the area next year.

The renaissance festival is a great experience,  with a lot to offer for kids and adults.  Food and drinks are delicious and only slightly pricey at $5 a drink and $9 for a Turkey leg. So much to see and do you can't fit it all into a single day!
Order of Wrath live steel fighting was the best event, in my opinion.  Where many of the other shows feel scripted, these warriors clash in a live, gladiator style arena that I felt was the most realistic and exciting show of the day! The joust was worth checking out as well, and interacting with the friendly characters throughout the festival really makes the experience unique.

name: Des Moines Children Museum
address: 1551 Valley W Dr Suite 108, West Des Moines, IA 50266, USA
reviews: My two daughters (ages 18m and 7y) love it here. There is tons for them to do and they add new stuff all the time. The employees are nice as well.
Cannot rate this place highly enough. A fantastic area for children of all ages. My son is 15 months and he had a blast. I'm excited to see how the upcoming projects come out.

Love this place and so does my daughter! It's still in the process of growing and it's not as fancy and flashy as other museums in the area, but it is ran with love and care. SO much to do and lots of new play stations developed thoughtfully. This place is a labor of love and truly a grassroots effort that is much needed in the Des Moines area. Give it a try, it's a wonderful and inexpensive way to spend a rainy/cold day!

Great place to spend a couple hours away from home!  Lots of fun spaces for kids to play and use their imaginations!  Cost is 4.50 per child ages 1-10.  The toys are changed out daily so there's always something new to play with.  There's also a party room in back.

small enough to be able  see  all the areas without losing site of the grandbabies, diverse enough to appeal to all interests of young children.  I took my 4 yr old grandson and 2yr old granddaughter, they had sooo much fun.

name: Iowa Hall of Pride
address: 330 Park St, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: One of my favorite places to visit in Des Moines! A rich history of the state and great historical perspectives of Iowa High School activities!
New volleyball display is amazing as are videos displayed in the 360 room. Hall of Pride is a fun interactive way to learn about Iowa.
I really enjoyed my visit in this place! I learned a lot about the people of Iowa through the interactive activities. I will definitely recommend this place.
The Rueben was great & I got a great dude salad!
The Hall is ok, but there's a lot of walking and elevators can be difficult to find for those needing one.

name: Des Moines Water Works Park
address: 2201 George Flagg Pkwy, Des Moines, IA 50321, USA
reviews: My 11 year old daughter and myself just completed a 5K at Water Works Park, they done some upgrades and it looks amazing. I was so happy to see the amphitheater it looks awesome. The walking trail that we used for the 5K was free of any trash or debris, its a very nice nature walking area we had a great time!

It's just a nice place to chill.
Usually quiet.
I saw the new fixture and thought I would take a look.
One of the largest natural parks in the United States. Almost twice the size of central park in New York. Drive through it is relaxing.
Nice trails seen a few deer. Good nice easy trails some a little more difficult but it's also February
Great courtesy at the counter and they make things easy for you to pay in person.

name: Jordan House
address: 2001 Fuller Rd, West Des Moines, IA 50265, USA
reviews: It was a fascinating tour of a historical home. The people who lived there and the fact that the home still exists are what's important here & of interest. The tour is very interesting and the guide I had was very knowledgeable. I'd recommend checking it out if you have time. Just try not to draw comparisons to Salisbury House or Terrace Hill.
Great tour guides!  So informative.   Great for groups traveling from other countries, too!

The house is unassuming from the outside but has a wealth of history inside. I took my younger son on a tour with me. He really likes history so he enjoyed it. I don't think it would be of interest to children that don't like history. There are two factors in play with this house. First, it was one of the first houses in the area. Second, it was discovered that the house was on the underground railroad. I would highly recommend this tour for people interested in one or both of those topics. The tour guide was very knowledgeable.
Tour hostess was very interesting and really explained a lot of the small Victorian details.  Our 12 and 16 year olds enjoyed it too!
Has a connection to the Underground Railroad. Original owner helped found Valley Junction.

name: Better Homes and Gardens Test Garden
address: 1716 Locust St, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: Calming. If you have questions staff available to onswer. Only open to public Friday noon to 2.

It was a bit difficult to find at first since our GPS took us to the main building across the street. Thankfully, we read a review here that advised this and we found it right away. A lovely oasis in the cities center and so many gorgeous new blooms! Definitely a must stop if you are in the area! Staff was friendly and very helpful.

Beautiful place to read, eat lunch, and stroll. Plus, they have experts there to answer questions and show you around. Would definitely recommend! They're only open for a couple of hours on Fridays (12-2) in the summer but it's well worth the trip over!
Beautiful oasis in the center of town
Excellent place to relax wonderful people to answer questions

name: Simon Estes Amphitheater
address: 75 W Locust St, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: Great place to go for an outdoor concert, sound quality is really good and there's not a bad seat in the house.
Very nice scenic place, nice views and a good park to walk.
Love riding bikes to listen to the music,for years
I like that it's right on the water and plenty of space.
Watched Satsang from the bridge, sounded amazing. Will be going here more.

name: Ewing Park
address: 5300 Indianola Ave, Des Moines, IA 50320, USA
reviews: Absolutely LOVE this course!! Some technical holes, some bombers, some straightforward holes. Awesome tee signs!

Beautiful spot to take a walk - some gorgeous paths and woods.
Open space if one would rather fly a kite or something.
Playground for kids
Such a great place!!
The entire park with all it's amenities wasn't cool enough..... a soapbox/Bmx derby tract, ran along side with a bridge that was awesome!
A great place to hike, jog and / or just walk around and enjoy the scenery.
It's a great park to play disc golf or just for a nice walk through the park

name: Brown's Woods
address: 465 Brown's Woods Dr, West Des Moines, IA 50265, USA
reviews: Huge upgrade in parking lot since Veteran's Pkwy was finished! Trail upkeep is only fair,  and the signage inconsistent and confusing. Props for having an audio tour! May I suggest a porta potty on the far end of the trail also?  Even so,  a hike on March 8th in 70 degree weather....AWESOME!

Beautiful 548 acres of timberland in SW Des Moines.  Sadly, there are invasive plant species needing groomed out.  Mostly Vines and honeysuckle.  It's choking the trees and causing fauna to nest too close to the ground. In turn the creatures are too close to predators.  Come spend a couple hours on Saturdays from 10am - noon and help the Polk County Conservation staff clean it up.

Beautiful, free nature trails with an abundance of wild flora and fauna.

There are several miles of looped hiking trails and a nice restroom area at the entrance. During our trip, we waved at a number of other friendly trailblazers along the way.

Highly recommended!

This is my favorite hiking spot on Des Moines! Be aware of the bugs during certain times of the year, but otherwise, no matter the season, these trails have the best views of greenery and nature and not too far to travel to get there.

We weren't actuality in Brown's Woods but at the dedication of the Folded Flags veterans tribute. This is a new sculpture consisting of 15 accurately modeled folded flags in honor of our nation's military veterans. They light up at night and are very cool to go see.

name: Fort Des Moines Park
address: 7200 SE 5th St, Des Moines, IA 50315, USA
reviews:
Lovely spot on the Southside of Des Moines to get out for some fresh air and photography walks. The trail around the lake is beautiful, with several bridges to feast your eyes upon while walking.

Come catch a sunset here! You won't be disappointed.
Good fishing nice new shelters with fire places inside the shelter for this type of weather

This is a hidden gem in Des Moines. It's modern and updated with paved paths, running water, handicap accessible bathrooms, and beautiful picnic shelters. It's a small but mighty park that can easily entertain a family for the afternoon or comfortably hold a reunion gathering.
You can capture some awesome pictures here.
Great place to hammock!  Lots of trail for walking, big pond great for fishing and kayaking

name: Living History Farms
address: 11121 Hickman Rd, Urbandale, IA 50322, USA
reviews:
We must have come on an off day. Not many people around. The printing press and blacksmith were VERY informative and talkative
 The general store employee said 'let me know if you have any questions' and silence. The woman in one of the houses said 'no I don't live here I just pretend to for 5 hours then I go home '
I guess I was expecting to be more immersed with role playing and a learning experience. 
I mostly just walked around reading signs, which was disappointing.

The tractor driver was great too!
Very fun for all ages. Worth going to if you love history
Takes you back to a time long ago! Extremely cool for adults and kids alike, we always see & learn something new!
We brought our kids here a few years ago, when they were just 6 and 4 years old.  We all loved it!  What an amazing way to learn about some of our nation's history!

I had the benefit of visiting the farms about 37 years ago when they were truly "living history". The people employed there were required to live and work as if they existed during the era they were portraying. So you got a real picture of life then, and they could answer questions for us about the tasks they were performing . Not so anymore. What's more, the people visiting had a sense of the worth of the kind of museum experience they were witnessing. They appreciated it. Not so anymore. I saw alot of students there with 1 teacher for 30 kids. Not behaving. No respect for others. Teachers helping kids pee next to the trail instead of using the restrooms. Kids taking things that had been placed as examples of tools used in the era. Extremely disappointing. I wonder what happened? Is this just another example of how the latest grown generation has little use or appreciation for why we used to teach our children manners and respectfulness?

name: Walker Johnston Park
address: 9000 Douglas Ave, Urbandale, IA 50322, USA
reviews: Quite an amazing public park! Kids will love the play areas!  My own kids have dubbed the slide the fastest one they've ever seen! Some beautiful walking trails surround the park and there are numerous Play areas where kids can explore! This park really has something for everyone.
This park is amazing. One of our favorites. A wonderful walking trail, multiple playgrounds in different locations, a pound. And so much more It’s a great park for kids of all ages.

Great little Ball Park lots of parking,  4 fields back to back , Soccer fields,  snack bar, bathrooms, play grounds,  plenty of parking 3 parking lots in the park and right next to the fields is a play ground for the little ones. Grocery store couple blocks away within walking distance for a long day in the park. Some tree shading areas around the ball fields which was a major plus especially for long days at the ball fields even days lol. Great place to hold adult softball tournaments,  but most of all youth travel ball tournaments great on site staff very friendly and helpful...No ATM onsite but take debit and credit cards for the snack bar reasonabley priced. Fields are pretty big,  takes a Big bat to Go Yard... Overall pretty good complex and we'll taken care of. Sorry and a skate park...

When I grew up here in Urbandale (left 42 yrs ago), we had minimal park development, probably very little money available, dumpy Little League facilities. Now, parks and trail system here are impressive in comparison, sculptures especially. If residents were only as friendly as they were back in the '70s... I feel like a stranger here for sure.
Fun place for kids to play. Nice playground. Big slides was popular for both kids and grown-ups.

name: Mainframe Studios
address: 900 Keosauqua Way, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: Had a great time at Mainframes First Friday event!  They have amazing artists working their craft and plenty of pieces for sale as well.  We really enjoyed JJ Gaffers and their glass blowing demonstrations!  Lots of great gift ideas too!
Very cool place to visit and the owners have such great stories about the rocks. Beautiful artwork as well. Great inlays on some specimens.
What an incredible space.  Definitely a place to stop in when all of the artists are open.
Salsa Des Moines...Excellent!!
I love that this space houses artists of every kind.

name: Iowa Women of Achievement Bridge
address: Principal River Walk, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews:
A very unique bridge with an even more interesting story behind the bridge. You will not visit a bridge like this in very many places! 
Dawn and dusk are great times for photos here, and it also doubles as a great way to park over the river and walk into downtown.
Part of the comprehensive bike trails around the city, you will be delighted walking across this bridge.
This bridge is very unique. Someone put sum time and thought into this beautiful landmark. Definitely worth the visit!
It's a wonderful bridge, has a point with a glass floor. It has artificial falls below which are wonderful to look at
Love walking on this bridge. It's so beautiful at night with the lights and the water
We didnt get to go on the glass part but we did enjoy the view

name: Legion Park
address: 301 Vine St, West Des Moines, IA 50265, USA
reviews: This is a fun park with great things for kids to climb on. They also have free lunch here in the summer. The splash pad is nice as well
My kids are really enjoyed it here usually try to go at least once a month when the weather is appropriate
Fun city park with quite a bit to do. Tennis, baseball, and basketball. Fun splash pad for the hot summer days. Swings and other playground equipment as well. Definitely will come back again!
Great play equipment for a variety of ages ranges. Love the splash pad!
My park growing up, been around since it's original look, have great memories here

name: Union Park
address: 725 Thompson Ave, Des Moines, IA 50316, USA
reviews: Great place for children to play nice park
A great park. Huge. There is a splash pad that is nice. You can't miss the rocket slide, as tall as it is. And check out the old timey carousel- it's fun for everybody.

Pleasant place to relax and have picnic while the kids enjoy, swings, slides and splash pad. The carousel was cheap and fun. The animal owners need to clean up after their pets and the rest rooms need attention.
I take my little sister and my puppy there almost every day (along as it nice out) and they love it some much especially the rocket slide
Have always loved this park since I was a little girl. Rocket slide wading pool

name: The Escape Rooms
address: 5465 Mills Civic Pkwy #120, West Des Moines, IA 50266, USA
reviews: Very fun experience! I went with coworkers who have not experience an escape room before either, and we all had the best time. We decided even before leaving the place that we will be coming back! Be prepared for a challenging hour (or less if you're lucky). Great way to build teamwork and work together to accomplish a rewarding end result.
Best escape experience in Des Moines, hands down! We did the informant, and Cheyenne our guide, was amazing!

This place is fantastic, and they were very flexible with us when we ended up booking the same room as another group of strangers. We had a blast figuring out clues though we definitely needed some help along the way. The staff is really nice and friendly and fun, and the room we got was aesthetically awesome! The rules were straightforward though the clues varied in difficulty. In the end, we escaped The Phantom with only one minute to spare! I'm excited to go back and try future rooms.

Harrison and Renea were amazing and helpful guides. There were 4 of us who did the Informant. The amazing guides made sure we were never stumped too long without revealing answers. This is my first time I've actually escaped a room and I felt incredibly accomplished! Well worth the money for a heart racing, cleverly designed escape room! I can't wait to go back!

We were here on a Friday night to celebrate my boys' birthdays. You need to make reservations for the timeframe you'd like (you get an hour for $25/person). We were able to get an 8:30 slot on Friday night, the day before we were going. Tickets are non-refundable, so plan well. 5-7 slots are available per room.

Gabe chose the hardest room, The Phantom. It has a 35% escape rate. We all had to sign waivers and promise not to damage things in the room. Then off to two videos about 2 or three minutes a video. One for safety and the other to set up the premise of the room. We were guided to the room, told we had unlimited hints and away we went. This room was waaay harder than we thought. In the hour, we got about halfway through all the puzzles to be solved, and we had decided to divide and conquer. This was our first time ever in an Escape Room and hindsight says we might have wanted to start on a different room as it took us a bit to orient ourselves and figure out where we needed to go first. 

But it was a blast!

name: Prairie Meadows Casino, Racetrack, & Hotel
address: 1 Prairie Meadows Dr, Altoona, IA 50009, USA
reviews:
Always have a fun time! There are a bunch of slot machines that get updated quite frequently with newer ones. The popular and classic slots are spread throughout the casino. Smoking section has more of a draw as it has the flashier machines up front. Whatever you decide to bet whether pennies to dollars I'm sure you can find a game to try your luck at. 

Also they have card games such as blackjack and poker, roulette, craps and digital versions of all games.

Love the new Sports Book! Been waiting so long! Glad Iowa wasn't last like usual. Looking forward to Poker online! Would be great for the state of Iowa. William Hill was definitely the way to go. Have used many sports book and by far they hands down are the best. Live lines by far are the best of any  Sports Books I've used (and this girl tried a lot!) Prairie Meadows has been a great thing for the community and love the expansion.
It nice to get out and do something different. They have a great buffet. And bands playing a lot. Every ones nice. A nice hotel.

Check in was suppose to be at 4. I arrived a little after that and had to wait until after 5 before my room was ready. They did apologize but at a place like this they could have made me feel a little better about it by offering a complimentary breakfast or something since my room was already steeply discounted by my company. The stay was good otherwise.

Hello their folks, stopped by thee prairie casino in Altoona Iowa, lots of fun here people. This casino has a lot of nice machine's and jackpots for people who want to win. This casino has a delicious buffet. I am giving this place 5 gold stars. Folks, in you can see a chance in Stopping, do stop by. Good luck.

name: Copper Creek Lake Park
address: 4390 E University Ave, Pleasant Hill, IA 50327, USA
reviews: There's always a cool breeze here, beautiful birds and natural scenery. This place is always busy, but never crowded. If you're playing Pokémon Go you'll find some people to play with. This is a really nice place to be.

Copper Creek Lake is a very nice lake with a well paved walking, and bike, path.

My family goes here a couple times a week just to get some sun and fresh air, and to let our daughter play on the playground for a little bit.

The only downside is that the walking path along the lake does not offer very much shade, so there are lots of times where you can get very warm very quickly, so make sure to stay hydrated.

The only thing that would make this place better would be if there was a port-a-potty at the north end of the lake. With so parents that take there little ones there it's hard to get them all the way back to the restroom area without them having an accident. Just a thought.
Great place to get out and enjoy the sunshine, walk the dog, jog, or play with your kids. A bit of country in the city!
Great looking park with a stocked "lake." Very peaceful walk around on the path which is a good length around. Perfect for a meditation setting.

name: Pioneer Park
address: 1650 E Pioneer Rd, Des Moines, IA 50320, USA
reviews: Well kept, quiet park with a great view of the capital building!
Never crowded during the day.  Nice place to bring the dog. Excellent photo op of the Iowa  capital. 👌
I was attending an activity here. There are cabins shelters playground and plenty of space to play for a large group. Plenty of nearby shade trees lawn kept well.
It was a good park, but they didn't have a basketball court for the boys so the kids had to do something else

This is the city park that time forgot. It used to be a very popular place for family outings but for some reason the crowds all forgot about it. Sure, there are still a few people who know about it, but there's plenty of room for those who can find. It's beautifully kept, with huge, ancient pines, picnic tables and a shelter, plus playground equipment for the kids. Pioneer Park is an island of serenity in the heart of the Southside.

name: Chamberlain Park
address: 2134 Woodland Ave, Des Moines, IA 50314, USA
reviews: Great playground for parents of young children. Very shaded with giant cottonwood trees, big picnic pavilion.

Chamberlain Park is a nice park just outside of downtown Des Moines.

There is a playground, a swing set, and a shelter.

The downsides are that there is not much parking besides on the street, and I didn't see a bathroom.

But probably the biggest upside is that there is plenty of shade, which is good for hot days.
Hidden gem. Didn't know it was there, but a very nice well kept park
There was trash there. Liquor bottles on the ground.

Great little park WITH SHADE! Almost always has other kids to play with. Couple downsides though. There's a broken (fenced off,) slide that hasn't been fixed yet and sometimes there's loiterers. 
UPDATE: I haven't seen any loiterers near the playground for quite some time. (Hooray!) Lately there's been lots of happy use from this park. The parents and kiddos who visit are generally very nice and polite

name: Ewing Dog Park
address: 4660 Indianola Ave, Des Moines, IA 50320, USA
reviews: We had a beautiful day at the dog park this weekend.  We hit just the right part of the day and there were 12 little guys in the small dog park (for 20lbs or less).  So much fun!!
Nice place to take your dog.  Well kept, nice dog owners attend, never had an incident.  Worth every penny of the dog pass.

Ewing was relatively clean and has an interesting slope design to it, so your pup will wear out faster due to running uphill consistently. The back half of the yard is flatland, so easy for people to walk around on. The only takeaway from here is there's no bins to dispose of waste bags inside the fencing. Just one way out in the parking lot upon entry.
We love the big open park that is available for our dogs to run and socialize. There is such a great group of people and dogs that are there. Poop bags are available. Water and bowls for drinks!!!
Very beautiful place and peaceful

name: MacRae Park
address: 1021 Davis Ave, Des Moines, IA 50315, USA
reviews: I like this park It's right across from where I work. I go there and sit and eat lunch sometimes. I like what they're doing to it and that new look out that they have. The city skyline is beautiful. They also built that new shelter out there. I would give it five stars if they had playground equipment for the kids.
Looks like the park is starting to clean up really nice. New overlook of downtown and what looks to be a new lake they are digging out.
Love the upgrades. Still need some more work, but still worth taking the family for a nice outing and picnic
EMC Overlook, within the park, has a wonderful view of downtown. There's a 1 way driveway that goes thru the park. Definitely a unique place to take out of town friends and family! Check it out!
a nice small park. Lots of big oak trees on rolling hills. Lots of improvements underway to enjoy soon.

name: Pete Crivaro Park
address: 1105 E Railroad Ave, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews:
Disc golf, playground, pavillion, tennis, and a constant flooded river adjacent to the park.  (Separated by a dyke)  The park is always well groomed and has city events frequently.  

Adjacent to the Central Iowa Bike Path.

A good place to take the kids or go for a picnic.

We went later in the day, was sprinkling but as soon as we arrived the rain drops had stopped. My son is an only child and the other kids that were there were very polite and friendly played with my son. The other parents seemed very nice and it wasn't so crowded. Perfect amount of people and kids!
It's an ok park, perfect for playing disk golf and a nice picknick spot. The playground isn't the best.
I really like this little city park.  It has a nice 9 hole disc golf course, which is very inviting to new players. The course is not too intrusive to the other activities the park offers.
Great place for family fun. The locals might overpower the pool area and parking is quite limited. The grand kids like it though, and that's what matters! 🏊

name: South Des Moines Sculpture Park
address: 768-798 McKinley Ave, Des Moines, IA 50315, USA
reviews: Unique art. Convenient location. Parking isn't straight forward - - watch the street signs for more info. Not super handicapped accessible for folks with mobility concerns and no amenities as it's a small city park. I'd definitely encourage folks to make this a stop on a road trip through the Des Moines area.
Nice small sculpture park
Nice little peaceful corner to enjoy beauty if art in the middle of residential area.
Went aways, out of our way to hopefully see a large park with big sculptures. But no, tiny park. Like for a swingset  and teeter totter size. Maybe 3 good pieces of art. Don't go out of your way.
A perfect place to relax and appreciate art and the Des Moines Southside!

name: Sargent Park
address: 3530 E Douglas Ave, Des Moines, IA 50317, USA
reviews: Small park good enough to stop in enjoy some fast food in the parking
Nice little park. Surrounded by nature and has a nice bike/walking trail. Also has a nice fountain for the kids to play in.
Kids loved the waterpark and it was Hours of outside fun
Awesome and beautiful place to go walking

Excellent park. There's an open air pavilion with picnic tables and bathrooms with running water. The playground is a natural playscape that has a rope bridge, a log tunnel, and small splash feature (which the kids love playing in). Just to the east of the playscape is creek access as well. This is the kind of park you can spend hours at.

name: Margo Frankel Woods State Park
address: Des Moines, IA 50313, USA
reviews: Good place to walk trails. Not good for morel mushrooms though.
It was so fun to get outside and explore the wilderness. I liked that I could go in the direction I choose.
Nice little state park with very nice trails and a couple playgrounds.
It's a good place in general but the trails need to be maintained more because of the main way to get to the park the bridge is no longer there if there was a bridge.
Nice park! We read there was hiking so we tried it out. One suggestion would be to have trail signage. We're looking forward to going back in the fall when the mosquitoes hopefully won't be as bad.

name: The Wallace Centers of Iowa
address: 756 16th St, Des Moines, IA 50314, USA
reviews: A culinary experience that shouldn't be missed. I'm hoping I can make more "Get to Know Your Farmer" dinners next year!

The food was FANTASTIC!  The atmosphere was warm and very welcoming.  Small setting with great food and great hosts made for an awesome evening. Headed back for their final meal of the season in December. Book this venue!!
Beautiful historic house with farm to table dining!
Went of the Thursday night dinner, beyond excellent.
Beautiful home with delicious farm to table meals. Will definitely be out to visit the farm this summer!

name: Ankeny Miracle Park
address: 310 NW School St, Ankeny, IA 50023, USA
reviews: Amazing park with massive play areas for all children's age ranges.  Almost feels like they could charge to play there.  A great hidden gem for free!!
This place is huge and very clean. Great for the kids and it helps that Ankeny kids are respectful and kind to other kids and adults. Great community to be a part of.
Very well kept. Love the colors and the sheer magnitude of the area.
My 7 year old loves this park the most out of all the parks in ankeny.  Lose one star for not keeping a bathroom open though
Fun and adventure in a local park

name: Central Iowa Railroad Club Inc
address: 3000 E Grand Ave, Des Moines, IA 50317, USA
reviews: Was pretty fun to walk through! Good for adults and kids. They've even got a little "I-Spy" game in there finding miniatures within the exhibit. Definitely worth stopping by if you're visiting the fairgrounds.
If you like model railroading, you'll love what these folks can do. Amazing layouts and realism.
Really enjoyed the way the system was set up. Also the questions or tips to find certain things in the layout.
Great public display of HO model trains in Iowa.
Nice layout, nice airconditioned building

name: Jester Park
address: 11121 NW Jester Park Dr, Granger, IA 50109, USA
reviews: Best little hidden gem that Des Moines has to offer. Make sure you check it out! It's dog friendly, kid friendly and family friendly. You could spend days here doing all of the activities!
I love all the activities offered! It's always fun, and of course you do learn or see something you haven't before. Everyone has been friendly and helpful!
Wonder well kept park.  Nice level campsites.  Plenty of amenities.  Nature scapes was a lot of fun.  Have been coming here for years and it’s just getting better as time passes!

Fun place to camp.  Lots of trees no matter what camping spot you choose.  Firepits.  Firewood for sale.  Showers.  Had a great time.  Highly recommend if you want a nice place to camp that is family friendly.  Will definitely be back.

Attended a Polk County Conservation lecture on Pelicans at the nature center. It was very informative, and taught by an authoritative naturalist.  The nature center is terrific, and has plenty of other things for small children to do. (Only a clueless baffoon would bring a toddler to a one hour lecture.)

name: Banner Lakes at Summerset State Park
address: 13084 Elk Horn St, Carlisle, IA 50047, USA
reviews: Oh, Yeah! This place is great. If you are bored of flat Iowa try the coal miners daughter trail (2 miles) and come back on the new ed beach trail and then use the road to get to the parking lot (about .75 miles total). Try the extra credit trail if you think you won't get lost on the most winding trails in the park. Hiking on the island in the middle of the north lake was really cool, first you go on the water front and then up on the ridge.
Love it, secluded place of peace and tranquility. It is a great place for admiring nature, photography fishing, having a picnic, relaxing, you can bring your boat, canoe, bike.
Nice little state park, the only bad thing I can say is the bugs were horrible

Gorgeous park with a lovely loop to view the water.  Nice hiking trails and paved bike path. Plenty of places to fish or just relax and enjoy lots of wildlife. ONLY downside is having to listen to that damn firing range.
Quite a quiet lil park good for the soul!

name: Peony Park
address: 1100 63rd St, West Des Moines, IA 50266, USA
reviews:
Super nice park, checks all the boxes (and then some):
- Dedicated parking lot with plenty of parking
- Nice-sized shelter
- Public restrooms
- One tennis court
- Full-sized basketball court
- Wide open spaces with what appears to be a baseball/softball field backstop

Also, the two playground structures both looked to be full of functional things to do (slides and ladders of varying sorts) with a good differentiation where one was clearly for younger kids and the other would work well for older kids.

This park has a bit of everything. Basketball court. Tennis court. Ballfield area. And good playground area (toddlers-elementary age) with wood chips in the ground. There is even a good size shelter with two rows of picnic tables. A grill for charcoal next to the shelter. Men's and women's public restroom. Great for walks or jogging. Hidden in a nice residential neighborhood. I don't live in this area but I envy those who do. Will diffently spot by if in the area again.
Clean, big trees, fun toys for small kids! Lots of open spaces. Nice neighborhood!
It's fun for the kids
Fun playground for the kids!

name: Des Moines Sky Walks
address: Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: A great way to get around downtown, especially in the winter! You can find me walking around here almost every day of the week. Several apartment buildings are connected to it as well.
Randy Kong is a very nice part of the skywalk experience- glad that he is there

Great when you come in the night, because theres no one there and it's calm. You have it all to yourself to walk around! Very nice views and inside there's cool places to take pictures. Highly recommended to Photographers! 📸
easy way to get around downtown DSM
Can't beat staying dry and comfortable while walking downtown

name: National Balloon Classic Field
address: 15335 Jewell St, Indianola, IA 50125, USA
reviews: Fun one time experience.  Great for picture taking and family friendly.

Great fun for family outing! Jason Brown on stage was awesome, plenty of food vendors (even a gluten free option!) Bounce house for the kids! Be advised that everything costs between $2-6, including bounce house and obstacle course. Bring cash! We had a great time. Very unique experience if you've never done it before.
Peaceful place to watch balloons when they come around

It was awesome the balloons were great there was a lot of them it was well worth going and the night glow was the best the kids got to go down on the field and got cards from the ballonist.  I recommend this to any one it was awesome, awesome. Lots of good places to eat there to. All around a 10 thanks for a great time.
This is a very awesome event. I know some people don't understand that balloons don't like A Lot of wind. It is just magical watching the balloons jump and come in to land. A wonderful experience!

name: Drake Park
address: 2300 Drake Park Ave, Des Moines, IA 50311, USA
reviews: Nice neighborhood park. Just one square block, but there are BBQs, basketball hoops and a playground. There is also a wading pool, but the city has been talking about removing it (2019) and has deferred some important maintenance.
Lovely under used local park.
My kids enjoy this park nice pool in the summer

Not a bad small park. Clean and some what well kept. Parking is a bit tight but you can still make it happen. Everything the kids wanted to do was right there. Small playground and a few other things made it a good place to run around for a bit amd burn off energy.
Would b a great thing

name: Geisler Farms
address: 5251 NE 94th Ave, Bondurant, IA 50035, USA
reviews: Very cool place to have weekend fun! There are lots to do there and kid friendly. We visited before Halloween to enjoy the maze and pick some fresh pumpkins. There’s also a food court where you can grab food.
Great place to spend a couple hours. Lots of activities for the kids and they love picking their pumpkins out at the end!

Well we found our way to kick of fall! So much fun! The kids absolutely love it. The apple cider was amazing. We got some apple pie and ice cream which was also delicious. We had a great time doing the maze and playing the games. They have a great playground for the kids while the adults play games or relax and watch sunset on the swings. I can’t wait to go back. It was awesome that everything was included in admission and food was reasonably priced. The kids loved the giant slide, and the air pillow. It was amazing! I highly recommend this place to anyone. This will definitely be our new family tradition.

This place is so much fun for not only families but a group of friends! There is food, corn maze, activities and lots of pumpkins. Definitely check this place out if you are wanting to enjoy the Fall weather!

Lots of fun activities for families! I do wish there were attendants making sure people were being safe. A giant woman was on the jump pad and fell into my daughter injuring her to the point we had to leave. Not really the farms fault...some people are just clueless.

name: Neal Smith National Wildlife Refuge
address: 9981 Pacific St, Prairie City, IA 50228, USA
reviews: Very important NWR of some the last remaining natural prairie. To the untrained eye it might not look like much, but this ecosystem is just an important as any other to our environment. Nicely maintained public information center and friendly staff.
Such great displays, so much hands on education, lots of viewing opportunities, plus a great drive around the park with elk and bison too!

We love Neal Smith! We love seeing the elk and buffaloes and we especially love the indoor area! There is so much to do for kids (and adults) of all ages. Bonus: It's all free! Our kids especially like the scavenger hunt bags for outside and the the puppet theater!

I wish I had known about this place when I lived in Iowa because I would have visited it often. They have a great range of trails and outdoor activities as well as some awesome inside displays.

We volunteered for Prairie seed cleaning which was lots of fun and very interesting. If you're around and have time they have lots of opportunities for volunteers.

The history and restoration of the native plants brings insight into today's healthy lifestyle of organic, fresh foods.  There is a larger than expected herd of free roaming buffalo.  There is elk as well; however we were unable to locate them on the 8,000 acres during our visit.

name: SIMON'S
address: 5800 Franklin Ave, Des Moines, IA 50322, USA
reviews: Amazing food and great service! Very charming atmosphere. Simon always walks around and checks in with everyone which makes you feel like a regular or right at home. Everything I’ve tried here is delicious but especially that artichoke dip!

Just ate at Simons for the first time tonight.  There was a huge line to get in and on a Tuesday night that is a good sign or so I thought.  The atmosphere is a little dark with some odd paintings but they have some cool lights which increases the ambiance.  Once we got seated the waitress was there to get our drink orders.
