When she brought us our drinks we placed our food order.  We got garlic cheese bread for out appetizer, salad with house dressing and stuffed chicken.  The food was ok but under seasoned.  Nothing was bad just not memorable.  At the end of our meal we got a free piece of chocolate cake and just like the rest of the meal it was okay.  We may come back to try Simons again but it won't be for a while if we do.

The food here is incredible and the experience is even better!! The owner is one of the most genuine people you'll ever meet and they treat you like family. This is THE best food in town and considerably under priced. The flavor will exceed your expectations every time. I can't say enough great things about this place!

I love this place! If you want great food and upscale  dining experience in a small neighborhood setting, this is your place. Simon the owner is always there and will greet you when you come in and will walk you to the door on the way out. This is nice personal service and his patrons are loyal fans. If there is a line for waiting he knows exactly when you came in so it's never a problem and no need to put your name on a list. 
The food is incredible, its high dining experience at very reasonable cost. Its ideal for a date setting as it's very cozy and comfortable. The place has a rustic feel with a splash of modernism. Lighting is low and atmosphere is welcoming. So if you are looking for incredible food and a cozy atmosphere without the price tag please visit Simon's. Wait til you see what's for dessert 😉
Amazing... Like always. Just go! Be patient if there's a wait, you'll be grateful you did!

name: Centro
address: 1003 Locust St, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: Excellent service! Amazing professionally cooked food! Definitely a great bargain and top level fine dining experience.

Tried it out based on the reviews. Excellent place to go. High end restaurant, with great prices. High serving. Would recommend to anyone. Their pickles spears are homemade. Their tomato basil soup with tortellini was the best, I never had tomato soup that good before. I would recommend the soup.

Family lunch. Great waitress Janelle or Chanelle. Wonderful onion rings and my Kill Bill Tenderloin was delicious! Pleasant chat with the manager and he was very much involved with the staff. He even cleaned the table next to us and was patient with our questions. One of my favorite places to dine.

The fries are fresh potatoes sliced and fried topped with a few pinches of salt. It is DELICIOUS! The chicken is crispy and taste SO good. Lastly the sundae was AMAZING. vanilla ice cream with creamy crunchy chocolaty goodness with delicious nuts throughout it. The best part about it is that its topped with toasted marshmallow covering the goodness until you start eating it.
Nice place for a date or other event. Has nice outdoor eating area. Perfect three months of the year. Everything on the menu is pretty good.

name: Bubba
address: 200 10th St, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews:
We made an early dinner reservation and had excellent service from the staff. The hostess was really helpful and our server Leviathan was very attentive and personable.

Absolutely order the hot brown and fried pickles, both were delicious. I got the waffle and fried chicken which was also really yummy. We were celebrating our 3 year anniversary and Bubba's comped our dessert (peanut butter icebox pie was phenomenal). Thank you for the dessert and helping us celebrate this special occasion and of course, for the great service and food! We'll be back :)

Nice place to celebrate birthday! Shown are 2 piece chicken with sides of Cole slaw  and cream corn. Also shrimp and grits. Group also had chicken pot pie., Kentucky hot brown sandwich and chicken fried steak. All enjoyed!! Great drink selection too

Even though we had a large party we still had great service. Very friendly staff. We tried 6 different appetizers and they were all excellent. Especially the mac and cheese bites. I ordered the chicken and waffles. The chicken was great. Not too greasy and nice seasoning. The waffle was huge and delicious with the honey butter. Had the whiskey pecan pie for dessert. It was phenomenal.

Great first visit.  We don't get downtown too much these days but this place is worth a special trip. The service was perfect I didn't even really look at the menu too much I just asked her what she thought was good, and she nailed it.  From cocktails to apps everything we tried was excellent. The butter me up, 🥃  leather and tobacco bourbon cocktails, so good. Spicy shrimp and grits, Smokey green beans, Fried Chicken, deviled eggs, some kinda fried crawfish thing, everything was great.  The only thing that bummed me out a little bit was missing the Raccoon River Brewing Company.

Nice lunch. Went in with a group of about 10 for lunch. We had a reservation so I was surprised that they hadn't put tables together prior to our arrival. They remedied that quickly though. Service was really good for a table of our size. Food all came out at once and I got several drink refills. I had the Southern Protein Bowl because I wanted something on the healthier side. Most of the delicious looking southern fare they serve doesn't really fit the bill. Although the protein bowl didn't not seem like an together cohesive dish, I appreciated the effort to give me something besides plain salad with chicken breast (which they also have if you are less adventurous and not willing to break the calorie bank). I will return when I'm in the mood to do live it up. The bread basket looked delicious.

name: Fong's Pizza
address: 223 4th St, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: Great service, great food, as always! LOVE Fong's pizza and the servers are always friendly and happy to help. Was delighted to hear I could try a can of cider and if I didn't like it I could order a different drink without being charged! I loved they would do this! (I really liked the Wilson's Orchard Cherry Crush cider so didn't need to change it, but would not have tried it without the reassurance I could change my mind! Food was served quickly and warm. Love their thin crust and delicious toppings! Can't beat Fong's, and even bought a second pizza to take home with us!

Any visitor to Des Moines must try Fong's pizza. The crowd favorite is the crab rangoon--and it won't let you down. But don't overlook other options. I enjoy the Thai pizza as well. You will find many nontraditional options on the menu. And check out the specials which rotate with the seasons--particularly around the holidays. Pizza innovation and a fun atmosphere!

I have always enjoyed Fong's Pizza. They have unusual combinations but they are well balanced and hit the spot.

The crust reminds you of good homemade style crust. It's not the generic dough that every other pizza joint seems to use. It's got good texture and it's just the right amount.

The toppings are fresh and quality. You're not getting a flavoured grease pizza, you are getting a pizza worth sitting down and sharing.

They have pizza by the slice and pizza by the pie. I recommend them to everyone.

Delicious pizza! I absolutely loved the crust. The waitress forgot to get my friend's drink, but other than that, the service was good. The price is good also. I was pleasantly surprised at how cheap our bill was. I'll definitely go back!
The service was great! The pizza was delicious.. Drinks were great. Definitely going to go back for more some day soon.

name: RoCA
address: 208 Court Ave, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: My husband and I had a great experience at RōCA! We had arrived early for our reservation and sat at the bar, the bartenders were very attentive and took their time explaining the drink menu or food menu, my husband had the Smoking Gun and I had the Maxwell’s Silver hammer, we soon were seated and try several shared plates, we tried the spicy green beans, Fondue, crab croquettes, ratatouille, and seared scallops. The flavors were so good! The only disappointment was there were only 2 scallops. For dessert had a Fig Manhattan martini. The server was very attentive and the chef even came out and checked on tables. Overall a great experience.

We had an awesome small plate experience here. Our family has a soft spot for fondue. It was great. We had the Thai shrimp and it was incredible. The reconstructed nachos are super tasty, but over priced. If they were larger it would be fine, but it's really only enough for one of you're not sharing and two if you are. The caipiranhas were excellent.

Wonderful pre-theatre spot. RoCA remains one of our favorite restaurants in Des Moines. The shared plates are delicious, especially the Asian Lettuce Wrap. Another favorite is the flatbread. Service is spot-on--friendly and attentive. Share small plates, or order a meal. If you're lucky, the dessert will involve a bubbly crisp a la mode. RoCA provides a friendly, comfortable dining experience with personalized service. A true gem!
Loved it the cocktails were delicious and the food spot on. You get what you pay for forsure

Great low-key place for cocktails and wine. My wife and I have been there a few times and have had great service each time. The wait staff offered excellent drink suggestions and the food was outstanding. Great place for a date night if you are looking for a place to have intimate conversations.

name: Django
address: 1420 Locust St, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews:
the french toast is life changing. best part of an all around amazing meal at a unique restaurant with great decor.
other notable mentions: the cherry sundae, poutine, and hanger steak (not pictured)
the shellfish plate was perfect for our group of 7 - the lemony mussels were my absolute favorite! would definitely come back.

The front desk staff were so polite. We got a seat at the bar and were welcomed by Shaun. He was one of the best bartenders I have ever encountered. Not only did he recommend his favorite app (calamari) but he made sure that we were taken care of. Everyone at the bar area deserves a raise. I even got a lesson on oysters. The young lady in the back answered all of our questions. I am so happy with our experience. Please come visit this restaurant.

The service, the food, and the price were all great. Went with my sister, her husband, my niece, my nephew, my cousin, and my girlfriend. We all enjoyed the meal. When they brought out the appetizer, my girlfriend mentioned how she wished she picked a different side; the staff overheard and changed it for her. This spot is great for savory and sweet. I also liked the movie Django Unchained. Ha... if you’re in Des Moines, go to Django!
Very busy, very loud due to Tuesday all night happy hour but we were very well taken care of by Clint. Friendly, but not overly so. Effecient and professional.

Sweet place. Great ambiance, great food and great service. A little pricey but you do get what you pay for. I liked the jazz music in the background too. Perfect place for a dinner date. Definitely recommend.

name: Alba Restaurant
address: 524 E 6th St, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: Came here for a date night and had an AMAZING experience. Felt that the dining area was congested - but forgot all about that as soon as we were seated. Our waiter made sure all of our questions were answered and suggested a few options based off other foods we enjoy. Highly recommend the parsnip bisque! Will definitely be coming back to try different dishes

Came here for restaurant week and the food was SO good. I have come here and few times before and the prices are a splurge for my husband and I but well worth it. The food is always so good and presented in a lovely way. The atmosphere is quiet and lends well to a good conversation. The service was great as well with great attention to detail.

Best place for fine dining in the area.   The chef's table is great to watch the kitchen and learn from the pro's.   Great wine and cocktail selection.   Wines are kept in a nitrogen dispenser so always fresh.  They are good at accommodating dietary restriction.
Great food & we had amazing service! What a cool ceiling above the restaurant! Will definitely visit again on my next trip.

The staff was extremely was extremely attentive and very accommodating. The dining experience was awesome. The presentation is very creative. The food was very hot when it was supposed to be. A little more expensive but worth it.

name: 801 Chophouse
address: 801 Grand Ave #200, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: Had a really good experience, David was our server. He did a great job of explaining the menu and the specials. Ordered the veal chops which were cooked to perfection. Got the iceberg salad.  Also got the scalloped potatoes and Expresso cheesecake. We brought some bottles of wine for a $25 cork fee per bottle.  Decor in the restaurant was nice, they did have the cows and farm murals on the walls which I thought we cool but didn't really make sense in the setting.

It was really good food. The Mac and cheese and for $1 more bacon. These were big chunks of bacon. My only complaint would be they are a little chalky from the flower but that's being but picky. The bone marrow appetizer was quite different and delicious. I liked it with the tomatoes as my wife liked it with the caper salad. The tomahawk steak was delicious. Cooked spot on. I would have preferred a little more salt and pepper seared on top. We were pretty shocked that the table next to us sent their steak back. The menu has what the temps mean. Underrated in all of this is the bread. The bread really was basically perfect. The service was amazing. The experience overall was a ton of fun. I wasn't a huge fan of the chocolate raspberry cake, but that's not the reason to go here. The cake itself was very good. I wasn't a fan of the raspberries (I love raspberries) and how the were in the middle.

Wasn't very happy with the food. The service, ambiance and location are all amazing. The food? Who the heck is cooking this? It was mediocre at best. I've literally had better EVERYTHING, elsewhere. I was expecting one of the best meals I've ever had and it didn't even register in the top 10.

Once again, DSM suffers from lack of taste. I'm not sure who, in their right mind, is rating the food so highly here.
Amazing food &. customer service. Michael was our waiter, and we couldn't have asked for better service. Great place to celebrate a special occasion.

Amazing steaks. Interesting appetizers. Excellent servers and staff.
Just know that this quality comes with a high cost. If you can afford it, it's fantastic.

name: Americana
address: 1312 Locust St, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: This place is deceiving before you enter, the layout is amazing nice decor, nice place to have a decent meal or happy hour. I was not that hungry so I ordered the Asian lettuce wraps with Ginger chicken. It had a nice taste to it something different for the taste buds. The service was on point the decor was nice two levels. I would definitely recommend this place

Americana used to be one of my favorite spots in Des Moines, for dinner and drinks and for brunch. I have done both recently, and I'm saddened to say that their quality has just gone downhill. The restaurant just has that cheaper restaurant feel now, instead of the upscale restaurant vibe it had before. And if you want to actually be able to eat & enjoy brunch food, don't go here, you'll spend the entire time waiting in line for the food.

I've had dinner and drinks here but this was my first time experiencing the brunch buffet for 32$. Wow, what a good time. Grilled cheese bar, all the breakfast options, soups, tacos, deserts, bloody Mary bar and mimosas and many more. The quality of the food is good and better than most buffets for having so many options. I will be back and try to bring many people with me.
Excellent service and food! My medallions were cooked to a perfect Medium Rare, and the mashed potatoes were to die for. I highly recommend!

I really dig this place for many reasons. The food is great. The ambiance is very cool! The adult beverages are well mixed. And the prices are very fair. Definitely check out the brunch it is gigantic

name: Zombie Burger + Drink Lab
address: 300 E Grand Ave, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: Fast service, even if there is a line. Glad to see this place has lasted years. Cool vibe and great food. I personally love the "Walking Ched" and the "He's Coming to Get You Barbara" burgers. Sure, they are probably not your healthiest options, but they sure are tasty!  My wife is a huge fan of their salads. The shakes are also tasty and they have a great selection of adult beverages. Highly recommend you try it!

I went here when I was on a road trip. Zombie Burger was a great place with fantastic food.  It wasn't enough to call them an establishment, but they certainly had a laid-back vibe and we were not disappointed.  From the deserts to the burgers, the food was a great deal.  The cashier at the counter was very knowledgeable and served all of us very well.  It was nice having her take us for our drinks or for a quick snack before making the long walk home. -TBT  (This place is called Zombie Burger and they are a great burger place.)

First time having it last night. I wish I could have made it before all the shut downs happened so I could see the fun decor lol... I absolutely loved the food! I am still full the next morning! Prices were better than I thought,  food was great! I would definitely recommend!!

I mean, if you’ve managed to scroll all the way to this review without knowing you should definitely be eating here, I don’t know how my words will help! Delicious food in a fun atmosphere with quality service. Check their Facebook for all the amazing photos - you won’t be disappointed!
We went to eat at about noon. It wasn't that busy so food was quick. Burger and fries were hot and fresh. Good customer service and friendly staff!

name: Buzzard Billy’s
address: 615 3rd St, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: Two thumbs up to Buzzers Billy's! A couple of weeks ago we celebrated our 16th anniversary and it has been a tradition to have dinner & drinks here every year (other then flood years) because we got married in Alabama and Buzzard Billy's makes it feel like we are in the south again. Of course this year we could not go out to eat so they brought the south to us! Had great food but was lacking our favorite Hurricane drinks. Not allowed to have alcohol delivered via 3rd party service but when the manager Jeff heard about our anniversary tradition he delivered our favorite beverage himself! I was so happy I forgot to give him the tip I had in my hand for him! A big thanks to Jeff and Buzzard Billy's for making our anniversary dinner fabulously memorable once again! Can't wait to come in for more great food and drinks in the future! Thank you Jeff!

I love this place and their Cajun food. I'm a big eater but it's a challenge to finish one of their dinners. Don't miss their Armadillo Eggs! Gotta have them every time I go. If I lived closer, I'd be there over and over again. Give them a try.

Very fast and friendly service. They always handle large crowds very quickly and with ease. The food and menu is large and excellent. Great place to visit before an event at Wells Fargo Arena or anywhere else downtown. Can quickly accommodate large groups and plenty of seating available.

Been here before and it's always good food. Alligator is tender and flavorful. The poutin was absolutely delicious! I was stuffed. The portions are great and so is the staff. Very friendly and inviting
Place was comfortable, and people were cool. Only downfall was my gumbo, dont think they cooked the flower down enough. Other than that enjoyed ourselves

name: El Bait Shop
address: 200 SW 2nd St, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews:
I love the atmosphere of El Bait Shop and think everyone must experience. They have a large drink menu so you’re sure to find something. 

I’ve gone there multiple times with the intention of ordering food as well as drinking, but there usually is absolutely no seating. We went over to Miller High Life but it was an absolutely different vibe so we decided to leave. I don’t know if it would be possible to designate an area for those dining as well, but something as such may help.

Great Staff! First time here and had some questions on the menu and they were very knowledge about the menu. 

They use local deli meats and it shows in the quality of the food! Everything we ordered was fresh and full of flavor!

Restaurant decor was different but interesting and created a relaxed local bar feeling that was very inviting for everyone.

Great atmosphere if you like bars with a laid back attitude and a ton of beer. You can't beat the beer selection. I've been to Des Moines twice and made sure to stop here each time. That being said, there is one bartender who always seems to have a chip on his shoulder. Other than that...the place is a gem.

Friendly folks, cool atmosphere. Driving through Des Moines & stopped in for a whiskey and some grub but there are tons of good beers to choose from so had a couple with my meatloaf..... the food was excellent! Good job bait shop!

Place is friggin awesome!!! Bartenders look out for their customers. Make sure they have a ride home after drinking. Appreciative of designated drivers. Mega fun atmosphere! Too many beers to even TRY in one day!!

name: Hessen Haus
address: 101 SW 4th St, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: If you love German beers, you'll love the only German beer house in Des Moines, the Hessen Haus.  For some reason people really enjoying drinking their beer from the glass boot, but clearly the 1L giant mug is a better deal.  Food is the typical German fare with a few choices of sausages.  We're not a huge fan of the giant pretzels either, but it's definitely soft and soaks up plenty of beer.  Actually, we usually don't care that much about the food by the second liter of beer.  Parking has been slightly problematic recently due to the closing of the lot next to the restaurant, but with some patience, a street spot does open up eventually.  The service is really good, especially for large parties.

Food was DELICIOUS!!!  When we first got there it was a few minutes before anyone even paid any attention to us. We had to sit at a dirty table and wait another few minutes before it was cleaned off.  After this.... it was definitely worth the wait. I will be going back!  (Hope service is better next time around)

Great German restaurant. German cuisine is honestly not my favorite but the menu had something even for me and it was delicious! I had a very nice waitress and enjoyed the outdoor seating on a nice evening.

Amazing! We lived in Germany for 7 years and this was the first German food we have had in the US that actually tasted German. We had a Jager schnitzel and salad and a giant beer. So yum! The spatzle was amazing too!  The atmosphere made us feel like we were back in Germany. We loved it!

I celebrated my PhD today in this great restaurant. happy to tell that we passed a pleasant evening and the restaurant was unquestionably one of the reasons for that strong evening. The stuff  cooperated in a very nice style, the cuisine was very good and my guests were so  glad. We shall definitely visit again for more joyful events. Thank you very much.

name: The Iowa Taproom
address: 215 E 3rd St #100, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: Awesome restaurant and wedding venue. Amazing food in both parts. Whatever they are doing in the kitchen - they do it so right! Haven’t had anything from here I didn’t love, and all of the staff I’ve met have been great. Absolutely recommend the taproom whether you are looking for a place to get married or just a place to grab a bite and a beer.

Awesome selection of Iowa beers. Very cool place whether you are from here or elsewhere (like me). I want to take this idea back to my state. Love to support local beers. One of the best selections of all kinds of beer I’ve run across.   Pretty lively for a week night as well. If I’m ever back in Des Moines, I’m headed here.

Went here for dinner with another couple. Although they were very busy and we had a bit of a wait, we had no problem being quickly served at the bar (which was completely packed) while we waited for our table. Food was amazing. Service was great especially for how busy they were. Menu was pretty simple. Mostly burgers and salads. Entree's were to be expected of a bar and grill.

The Iowa Taproom was a nice end to my VERY long day yesterday. The hubby and I split a self created flight and we all ordered something different so everyone could try everything. There wasn't one thing that we didn't like. The quality of the food, the taste and the value for the money was excellent. Our service was excellent and we all enjoyed the warm and calm atmosphere. It was a very enjoyable experience and I, personally, can't wait to go back again.

We had a great time here! Beers were great, as was the service. The craft root beer they have on tap is delightful as well. We had a variety of appetizers and meals, all of which were very tasty and satisfying. We would definitely return!

name: Proof Restaurant
address: 1301 Locust St C, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: Picked up dinner for two and a bottle of wine for our anniversary. The food was still amazing by the time we got it home and out to eat and the service over the phone to pair wine was great. It made for a memorable and special anniversary dinner even though we couldn't dine at the restaurant while social distancing.
Little bit of a wait on the food, but well worth it.  You can tell by the use of whole spices and the preparation that your getting scratch made. I took customers there and they enjoyed there meal.

If you like food as art, then certainly go. What we had was tasty and interesting. Wasn't really a fan of the "industrial chic" decor. I'm not a big eater and don't care for hugh portions, but seriously, it was three spoonfuls if this, a single bite of that, and a few squirts of goo to decorate the plate. My husband walked across the street after a five course meal and got a sandwich at Jimmy John's.
Great food, exceptional service, definitely a repeat. You get what you pay for. Love fancy menu
Food & service are top notch! Drinks were amazing, service was amazing & food was beyond amazing! Highly recommend it! Chef Wilson is doing some amazing things check him out!

name: Tursi's Latin King Italian Dining
address: 2200 Hubbell Ave, Des Moines, IA 50317, USA
reviews: Shown are pasta trio and lasagna.  Also had sampler appetizer.  Soo much food. All delicious.  Have not been here in awhile. Has not missed a beat! Won't wait so long next time!

I liked Latin King. It was more expensive than I thought it would be, with a upper/mid scale feeling. We visited late, but we're still given mostly good service. Ended up being the last table seated, with 5 people and felt forgotten when we were ready for the check.
I will be back, but moreso for a date night rather than a family outing. I will come a little earlier also, so I'm not the last person out.
I wasn't treated badly, but had a longer wait as the staff were closing up for the night- just to clarify

We met with friends for lunch who had long ago recommended Tursi's as a go to place for Italian dining. My regret is that we did not go sooner. Great atmosphere, exceptional food, congenial service. Definitely one of those places to go for any ocassion.

This is my favorite restaurant! 💕 I have almost grown up going here.  I’ve been to birthday celebrations, going away parties, graduation dinners, anniversaries, family outings, lunch, you name it.  We always see someone we know, hang out at the bar w/the awesome bartenders, & meet new friends. The owners are wonderful & always make you feel welcome.  The servers are top notch!  Tip them well they deserve it! 💗 The food is Italian awesomeness.  Pollo piccata es delicioso (ok I probably spelled that incorrectly...).
Everything was amazing! The ambiance, the service and the food was absolutely outstanding! Thank you for the great experience 😊👍👍

name: Skip's
address: 4000 Fleur Dr, Des Moines, IA 50321, USA
reviews: I celebrated my PhD last night in this excellent restaurant. Well we had a superb evening and the restaurant was unquestionably one of the reasons for this outstanding gathering. The crew  contributed in a gorgeous manner, the cooking was great and my guests were so  pleased. We shall absolutely visit again for more events. Thank you very much.
Friendly and fast service.  Lighting was a bit dark, but the food was good.  Not amazing, but good.  The service was phenomenal though and made the experience great!

The best steak I've had in my entire life and trust me, I've eaten ALOT of steak! Cooked to a perfect medium rare for me and well done ( yes I know that's a crime ) for my husband. Amazing atmosphere, fabulous service from Jasmine and DELICIOUS food. Rather pricey but honestly worth it. Highly reccomend!

So good!!! From service to food, awesome choice for eats. Intimate setting without being cramped. House dressing divine. Able to converse with dining companions because the music is tastefully light in the background.

If you are looking for atmosphere.. you can find it here.  Cozy place and the service was excellent.  Good menu and grabbed a steak.    There are cheaper options, but again of you are looking for ambiance this is your huckleberry.  Will be back.

name: St. Kilda
address: 300 SW 5th St, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: Visiting from Minneapolis and found this great stop for a trendy, fresh food type of lunch. The atmosphere was modern and chic. We had the salmon club and Turkey sandwich- both were incredible- fresh ingredients, rich flavors, and very filling. We might even grab food for the road tomorrow because it was so good. I would highly recommend!

The Chef has created a menu beyond compare. The dishes have such full flavor and incredible ingredients that your palette will be satiated! The portions are perfect and the presentation is artistic. The atmosphere is beautiful, however, the clientele is young and fashionable and the temperature is a bit chilly. The food is so spectacular that I will return to try each item on the menu! Enjoy!

First time here and I am very impressed! Food was amazing, service was amazing and coffee was great. My only complaint would be that I wish they had syrup for their coffee as I would have loved to get a vanilla latte! 10/10 will be back.

This is the best place in town for a quick upscale breakfast with fresh ingredients and perfectly done eggs. I alternate between my favorites of Avocado Toast with poached eggs or the Everything Bagel Toast with poached eggs-so much flavor. Ambiance is upscale but not stuffy. Prices are over $10 for breakfast, but it is necessary for high quality ingredients and perfectly prepared food. Worth every dime!

St. Kilda has some great eclectic dishes. We went for breakfast I had the breakfast tacos which were delicious. My husband had the "cubano" sandwich... we are from South Florida and he said that sandwich could compete with the Cuban sandwiches back home. Definitely, high praise from him... go try it and let us know what you think!

name: Court Avenue Restaurant & Brewing Company
address: 309 Court Ave, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: And excellent desserts too! We've often enjoyed happy hour and the excellent appetizers but tried some desserts last night. The chocolate raspberry cheesecake was rich & wonderful. The apple crisp was delicious and made for sharing. We keep finding more reasons to come back!
One of the first spots I tried in Des Moines is still great every time. Good food with a couple of veg options plus great local brews and cocktails.

This place has some great food options. They also have indoor or outdoor seating available. Last but not least is their beer selection! They have some great options on tap.  If you are in the Des Moines area stop in to this upscale bar and restaurant.
Food and beer were great. Friendly service. Seating area furthest from the bar is a bit dated. It's what you see when you first walk in, so not a great first impression.

Wing were top of the line. I would say the best wings I’ve ever had. The servers were very kind and were very speedy when it came to our drinks and food, despite being basically full to the max. Will definitely be back

name: Malo
address: 900 Mulberry St, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: Had the seafood Nacho's. I was puking all night and woke up with really bad stomach cramps. I'm sure that seafood was bad! Had to of been left out all day. My first time ordering will definitely be my last. I had heard amazing things about this place. They were not spot on.

I’ve gone here for dinner before and loved all of it. I tried their brunch and everything was amazing! From the service, to the drinks, to the food. Our waitress was extremely nice and attentive. I will definitely be back!

So the drinks are pretty good here. And the bartenders are awesome, super attentive and friendly. 

I got the pork tacos and they were pretty good. Not the best I have ever had but the staff and ambiance made up for them. Again these tacos were good, just not the best I have had.

Unique Midwest take on Mexican flavors. The flavors are all there but the remix of proportions makes the food special.

Very friendly staff and nice ambience.

I enjoyed the venue; very clean, cordial staff, and nice patio area where we sat. I would definitely make this a spot for taking my wife on a date night. However, I didn't agree with the prices. For 3 tacos, a sandwich, 3 salsa dips, and one drink it was just shy of $50. I understand trying to set yourself apart and make it upscale with a unique style/flavor/take but when it boils down to it other places are much cheaper for roughly the same quality in taste.

name: The Grateful Chef
address: 1938 SE 6th St Suite 103, Des Moines, IA 50315, USA
reviews:
Finally made it to this local gem, and it lived up to the recommendations. I'm vegan and the selection was great, plenty of options, both ready to eat and frozen.
You can also pre order food, which I've heard is also really top notch food. 
Stop by and try this place out if you haven't already.
Absolutely fantastic place! Every single thing here is out of this world delicious.  The staff is very knowledgeable. I love this place so much. So happy to have it here in Des Moines💜

I stumbled upon this Gem last fall and am a weekly patron. Brandy, John, and their team are passionate about their mission. Inventive, Real, wholesome and minimally processed food is at the heart of their weekly menu. I've tried many items from freezer and frozen cases. Chia pudding, stuffed pepper soup, chicken pot pie, tuna salad crunch, chickpea hummus, are just a few of my faves. The quality is superb and I love that they arent afraid to season the foods with spices and herbs. This is a Far better option to have healthy meals from a LOCAL small business than ordering the food boxes online. Highly recommend!

I visited The Grateful Chef to grab something quick and healthy for lunch recently and was surprised by how unique and wonderful this place is. It seems like more of a location to grab larger, pre-made lunch and dinner meals - there is a giant selection of really creative, delicious sounding meals that need to be taken home and baked off. As for me and my needs, I was wanting something immediate and had a hard time between choosing the grab-n-go options... so I got the two that I wanted most: A fresh veggie and hummus sandwich and a smashed chickpea salad. The sandwich was very fresh, had unique flavors and texture, and was both light and balanced, and the smashed chickpea salad was also exciting with the flavor combinations and texture (red onion, dill pickles, turmeric, mustard). I don't have any allergies and haven't adopted any sort of diet (gluten-free, vegan, etc.), but these options both fell under those categories and I completely loved them both.
I am new to Des Moines, and even more new to what the south side has to offer, so this was such a wonderful surprise. I will definitely be back and plan on telling more people about this place - especially friends and family that are looking for exciting vegan &/or gluten free options.

The grateful chef was an amazing place so many organic made to order pre-made meals it was just absolutely a fantastic place to bedefinitely a top choice for any vegans out there that want a good quality meal for a very good price and the juice cleanse juices they have outstanding

name: Johnny's Italian Steakhouse
address: 6800 Fleur Dr, Des Moines, IA 50321, USA
reviews: Meal was excellent, very fine dining location is great close to airport. Staff is very knowledgeable in the food selection. Will be back to explore more great menu options.

The customer service was outstanding. The food was delicious and the prices were reasonable. The atmosphere was friendly and also romantic. It made date night an incredible success. I highly recommend this place.

Wonderful!  A great restaurant in an easily accessible location.

The staff is amazing and quite helpful.  The food is awesome.  I had a sirloin with crab stuffed shrimp and the meal was amazing.

Birthday meal after work.  While this place requires reservations it is worth it.  Expensive, but the meal was really good.  There were five of us and not everyone got steak.  Every meal was quality and the waitress was great.  Easy to find and enjoyable atmosphere....just save up to pay for it.
Absolutely wonderful! The food was delicious and not just the main course. The mashed potatoes were so tasty! Hopefully I have the chance to come back.

name: R I Restaurant
address: 6587 University Ave, Windsor Heights, IA 50324, USA
reviews:
Be ready for a dessert surprise!  Try the Blue Cheese Cheesecake.
Total enjoyment.  The visual is unique and the taste is AMAZING!
Finish off a pleasant evening of conversation and fine food with a delicious dessert.
Incredible tasting menu last night for our anniversary dinner.  The service was really great and the food was great as well.

Wow. Our dinner and experience was delightful. From the knowledgeable servers who provided thorough descriptions of what we were eating ( including how to best consume) to the thoughtfully constructed, well-executed courses, we loved every course. The scallops were perfect and the short rib was melt-in-your-mouth delicious. At the risk of being overly fawning: service, drinks, appetizers, mains, desserts—all A+. We’ll be back. Soon.
Fabulous experience! Delicious, creative and so many layers of flavor in each course. Andria our waitress did a lovely job too!
Nice small menu and attentive staff. Will be back.  Food is great and so are the unique cocktails!

name: The Royal Mile
address: 210 SW 4th St, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: We showed up at around 11 a.m. on a Saturday when Farmer's Market was winding down. We wanted to get a bite to eat and something to drink. We got seated right away, and there was only a handful of other people sitting at the bar area and a couple of tables with customers sitting in their outdoor area. So they definitely weren't busy. Then it took about 15 minutes before the server arrived to take our order. 15 minutes later, glasses of water arrived for everyone. 10 minutes later beer arrived for everyone. So this is primarily a bar and from the time we walked in the door and were seated, it took 40 minutes for beer to arrive to our table at a time when they were definitely not busy. The food items to choose from at that time consisted of their breakfast menu. The Guinness potatoes and onions were quite undercooked. So the beer was just fine, but the food was not so great, and the service was pretty slow.  I really liked a lot of the decorations, and it did have a design aesthetic which is reminiscent of an English pub. But unfortunately the food and service were just not up to par.
The actual bar/restaurant was closed due to Covid-19 but the outside was nice to check out. Great space for a drink or just a quick walk thru.
Love this place right in downtown Des Moines cocktails and banger Bites.   Breakfast on the weekends is great.
Just placed a takeout order for dinner. The Cornish Pasty was so good. The asparagus was perfect. I ordered an extra coleslaw - it was every bit as tasty. I coupled it with a Bellhaven Scottish Ale.

Great British eats. Unique food not found anywhere else in town. The booze selection is awesome as well. I wish it was closer to my house. If it was I'd dine there 2-3 times a week. Great over all pub and grub.

name: A Dong Restaurant
address: 1511 High St, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: I have refused to get take out during this pandemic, for obvious reasons. But tonight I decided since A DONG is the cleanest restaurant I have ever been to on a regular day, I would order from them. I walked in wearing a mask, they had baby wipes, disinfecting wipes and hand sanitizer on the counter for customer use. The polite wonderful lady that rang up my order, wiped my debit card before handing it back to me. She gave me a complimentary ginger tea and an extra order of springs rolls on the house. They were clean, courteous and the food was delicious. Not only are they the best restaurant in town, but they are the ONLY restaurant for a pandemic. I was so impressed.

We were not disappointed on our Sunday afternoon trip to A Dong.  Pleasant atmosphere, quick and competent waitstaff, and delicious flavors in every item we tasted.  Will gladly return to sample more from the sizable menu.
The staff was attentive, and our order came fast. The food was better than anywhere I've eaten in town! I can't wait to go back.

I've been coming here regularly for years and this is one of my favorite restaurants! There is a huge vegan selection and the food is always fresh and delicious. Great customer service and extra sanitation during this time!

Consistently great! My sister recommended this place to me when I first moved to Iowa about 10 years ago. It has been one of my favorite places. Remember that this is Vietnamese food, not Chinese food. Some people go there expecting it to be something else. It is a very clean restaurant with super friendly staff. There is never a long wait for your food. Everything is done in a very timely manner. Same menu for lunch and dinner, with a lot of different options. Everything is fresh and comes in good size portions. Not expensive either.!

name: Mi Patria Ecuadorian Restaurant
address: 1410 22nd St, West Des Moines, IA 50266, USA
reviews:
This is one of my favorite places to eat. Ecuadorian food might be my new favorite!

Also, our server was very kind when we went a few weeks ago (when we could still eat in the restaurant). I love small restaurants like these. The food is delicious and the service is great. I highly recommend!

It was my first time having this type of food and everyone at our table loved it. We got a wide range of items on the menu and our server went above and beyond making us feel comfortable and took his time explaining items on the menu as well as helping with suggestions. I will definitely go back when I am in the area again.
This is one of my favorite restaurants. The prices are extremely reasonable, portion sizes are large, the staff is very helpful, and the food is delicious. I would highly recommend.

My husband and I have been here a few times now and we have even brought our kids,  they are always very friendly and efficient!  They make sure they greet you and let you know they will be right with you even when extremely busy,  they get to you asap and you don't wait long to be seated and have drinks and order taken was only 3-5 mins and that was with a full house they literally only had 4-5 small tables remaining when we arrived and we arrived at the same time as another couple and they we're seated at the same time as us and order taken right after ours!  We always have a great experience,  and their plates are well worth the money!  The kids plates also come with a large amount of food!  You will not be disappointed by coming here!  I highly recommend it!!!
Love the place! Try to get here once a month! I have never had a bad experience here. The food is great and the service is always exceptional. Everything from the salsa to the dessert is awesome!!

name: The Walnut
address: 1417 Walnut St, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: Never had a bad experience here. Great food and a nice selection of craft beer and cocktails. Light, airy atmosphere with high ceilings and large bay windows.

Omg I LOVE this place. The food is phenomenal and reasonably priced. The adult beverage I tried was a lemon berry cocktail. It was strong and delicious. On top of all that, all of the staff are extremely attentive, professional and all around great at what they do!!! Couldn't be more pleased 😊 ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
Great atmosphere,  delicious food. Great place for groups to gather and socialize.
Very diverse menu, interesting daily specials, very fair pricing. Highly recommend coming in multiple times without having a "regular order".

Easily the best pretzel bites you'll find anywhere.  The cheese sauce is very obviously house made and I would consider trading state secrets for the recipe. (The server informs me that it's the same cheese sauce they use for their mac & cheese.)

The chicken pesto bowl has a rather more subtle and smokier pesto, which works to the benefit of the dish. Many pesto recipes over-salt the sauce, which would overshadow the mushroom and fresh tomato flavors. Definitely a solid choice for the salt-conscious as well as those looking for a meal not dominated by one flavor.

name: HoQ
address: 303 E 5th St, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: The food was great but the black raspberry cobbler was insanely good
My husband and I had an excellent dinner here. The staff were great, and the food was incredible at a very reasonable price. I’m bummed I didn’t know about this place sooner. A

What  a delightful and amazing place, so wish l had gone sooner. Beautifully balanced space and menu.The beet salad was perfect in every way, acid,beautiful greens,good to the  nose and palate and a small portion. I will be back with in the week  for another wonderful experience focusing on local and well considered ingredients.
Wonderful farm fresh food. Great ambiance and attention to detail.

I've always had a great experience at HoQ.  The food is amazing, and I love that the menu is always changing to include seasonal ingredients that are also as local as possible.  Portions are a good size--not too small and also not too big.  Staff are friendly and knowledgeable about the menu.

name: Mullets Restaurant
address: 1300 SE 1st St #1253, Des Moines, IA 50315, USA
reviews: Their breakfast menu is crazy good!! I also love that they have chorizo. Nothing on the menu is bland or boring but completely the opposite. This is the place I'll bring my guests that are from out of town to, it's never fails. Also love that they're right on a bike path. Can get real busy but the turnover is fast. Definitely recommend Mullets.

It was very good.  We started with ribs and burnt ends (meal) with sweet potato tots and onion rings, but shared it as an appetizer.    I ordered the breakfast nachos and they were awesome, but I was already stuffed.  Can't wait to go back!

We live is West Des Moines where it is FULL of good places to eat, yet we will DEFINITELY drive downtown just to get to eat here. Food and drinks are AMAZING and the prices are VERY affordable! If it wasn't for the fact that it is almost ALWAYS packed of people (with good reasons) we would come here more often. The service is also great! Servers are VERY friendly and the service is fast as well! FULLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!!!!

Everything was amazing. The ribs were smoked perfectly. The Mac and Cheese was cheesy and a little sour. Loved it. The broccoli was burnt just slightly. The cob salad was huge. You got to try the sweet potato fries and the marshmallow dip stunned everyone at the table.

Nice place with lots of choices. Friendly fun staff. Yummy food and very cold beer.  was clean, little on the small side. They do have a patio, looks over the river. They serve breakfast and have Sunday Brunch.

name: Aposto at the Scala House
address: 644 18th St, Des Moines, IA 50314, USA
reviews: Phenomenal, went for Valentine's dinner and the food was delicious and the proportions were pleasntly more than I expected for fine dining. Needles to say my girlfriend was very impressed.

I ordered a fresh salad. It was so good I practically inhaled it. Had the chef's special, or part of it at least, because it was so good everyone had to sample it.  They also make ice cream there, and we happily had some of both flavors for dessert. It was just the perfect meal.

It was so good I didn't get photos. The food is delicious but you're going to pay for it, but it's so worth it. It's very much a special occasion place and you'll enjoy every minute of a the candle lit, nice old house vibe.

We started with the polenta cakes which were simple but incredible. They were a perfect, light starter. Then I followed up with gnocchi (literally the best in Des Moines) and my boyfriend got the New York Strip. Both were delicious and came with great sauces and were perfectly portioned. We left stuffed, choosing to drink our dessert downtown.

My recommendation is to make a reservation. It's a small place that can fill up quick. Also pick a meal and wine pairing the wait staff recommends because there are lots of things you can't get anywhere else. They know what's best so you better trust them 😉.

My wife and I loved it! Great atmosphere, servers and guests are all so positive. It feels like the perfect place to go for an intimate dinner with your loved one. Food was delicious. Highly recommend the gnocchi!

The absolute best! Simple food done right. Delicious!  
There is no parking on site. So streetside parking could be a challenge at certain times.

name: Angry Goldfish Pub & Eatery
address: 2301 SW 9th St, Des Moines, IA 50315, USA
reviews: Amazing dinner experience at The Angry Goldfish. We had an awesome waitress who was also working as a bartender! We didn’t catch her name, but she was wearing a maroon Exile t-shirt! Our drinks, apps and food came out so quickly and everything was hot and AMAZING! We ordered the Sriracha goldfish and the pretzels and beer cheese for appetizers. (Beer cheese and pretzels were OUTSTANDING!) Then, we ordered the crispy chicken sandwich with pepper jack cheese and a side of mac and cheese and the meatloaf meal. Both were amazing and we would eat again! Then, I paid and accidentally left my card. The waitress came running out to our car to give it back to us!

This place has a clean and cozy atmosphere! The food.... the food is PHENOMENAL. All homemade food. Small menu, which for me is perfect, with tasty choices! Their AG burger is definitely a go-to. It has a zesty sauce on it that's to die for!
Their signature spicy goldfish crackers are really good and honestly, I grab some to go, too! 
This place is perfect for our date nights!
Small neighborhood atmosphere with home cooked food and a relaxing environment. Whether your in work clothes or dressed up you should feel comfortable. Wait staff is amazing. Worth checking out!

The place is pretty chill and the interior looks cool. Especially like the bathroom sign, it gave me a good laugh. Had a small poutine with my wife which tasted very good, nice strips of steak and delightfully savory. My wife had a Goldfish Mule which according to her was on point and one of the best that she ever had. We both tried the fish and chips which I very much liked. My wife was excited that they made not only all of their entrees fresh but the sauces were homemade too. Great atmosphere and the staff was friendly, be happy to come back again.

What an amazing place! We stopped in on a Saturday around 12:30 to a crowded house. The only seats available for two of us were at the bar. We were greeted with friendly faces and INCREDIBLE customer service. Monty was our server, but the other bartenders chipped in for drink refills, etc. 
We started out with fried pickles, then I ordered the warm bacon salad (minus the feta) and my son ordered the Sriracha tenderloin and fries. We split the fries with a side of brown gravy. Everything was absolutely superb. It was fresh and hot out of the kitchen, and even after finishing our meals, the remaining fries were cooler, but still delicious. The dipping sauce for the pickles was spicy and I assume has Sriracha, as was the tenderloin, obviously, but not so hot that it was overwhelming. There were just great mixes of flavors.
This was my first visit, but I will be back. It was so FANTASTIC!!

name: Gazali's Mediterranean Grill
address: 1205 25th St, Des Moines, IA 50311, USA
reviews: I go with my wife to this great spot many times a year! This is my favorite spot to pass a nice evening.  I go there many times. The food is fantastic, the staff members are helpful and the price is affordable. I like going in this spot to have a good supper.

This is an authentic flavorful hot spot. Line out the door for lunch. I had the vegan burger (house made)  that is delicious. The Lentil soup was spices perfectly. And the butter in the baklava I swear came from a blessed cow. Well done. I am in awe of the level of mastery coming out of this kitchen.

We were looking for a lunch get away from Lutheran hospital. Searching nearby restaurants, we found this little gem. Friendly staff, really good food, and fast service. We enjoyed the lentil soup and gyros-very tasty and not greasy whatsoever!
There is a well stocked bar. This place is located a couple of doors down from old Varsity theatre. Vegan options.

Love the veggie/vegan options and the coffee!  The pistachio baklava is outstanding.  I don't eat beef, so can't comment on that.  The chicken dishes and stuffed grape leaves are amazing.  A must for Mediterranean food  lovers!

Just had amazing lunch here. Excellent chicken wrap, meat was soft and juicy, Pita soft and fresh. Also had a side soup and a hot tea. Best $12 I’ve spent in a long time. Owners are so kind and hands on, run the counter themselves.  Plenty of seating. Can’t wait to eat here again. Thank you for an excellent meal.

name: Akebono 515
address: 215 10th St Suite 120, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: Oh my gooOOooOod. You'd think a landlocked state would have bad fish. This sushi legitimately rivals the stuff I had in Tokyo. Some of the best sushi and fish I've had in the states.
This place always delivers on taste.  The service is quick and place is clean.  My two favorite rolls are the o snap and rising sun.  They are a must try!
AMAZING service. Great prices. Excellent food. Our waiter made great recommendations and even threw out a surprise non-menu item. Great experience.

Have visited this restaurant several times. There sushi is good, but wouldn't be a raving fan by any means. There staff always seems to be slightly behind the ball too which for what you are paying you would expect more. For example, we had to wait like 10 minutes to get small plates as they were all out of them and waiting for them to come out of the washer... There Saki bombs are less than desirable on presentation too.

I really like this place. I do wish that they had more vegetarian options though since I am vegetarian. But the veggie tempura and the fried tofu with the Mayo sauce are pretty filling. Their presentation is really good as well and the servers are friendly. Definitely recommend 👌👌👌

name: Tumea & Sons
address: 1501 SE 1st St, Des Moines, IA 50315, USA
reviews: Very nice homely Italian food. Everyone was friendly and the cheesy garlic bread was on point. Chicken dishes were tasty and cooked perfectly. Only thing to mention is the lack of vegetarian options. The mariana sauce is cooked in meat so out of luck if your not a Alfredo person. Didn't try dessert but was probably legit.
Best Italian food in the metro. Service is amazing and the food is yummy!

Ordered their chicken saltimbocca and it was OUT OF THIS WORLD! No joke, their food is the BEST in the city, hands down. Great atmosphere, amazing food, large wine selection with full bar and the service in on point. I need more stars!
Generous portions, good food. Will be back again. I had the Penne Salsicca entre with garlic cheese bread for an app.
They offer a great range of delicious food. I enjoyed dining here. The employees are always helpful, prices are affordable and the place is always neat.

name: Eatery A
address: 2932 Ingersoll Ave, Des Moines, IA 50312, USA
reviews:
Pleasant comfortable setting with good service but food was just ok. Our group tried different lunch dishes and all agreed there was nothing special. My ice tea tasted old. Grilled cheese with hummus side looked very good but all tasted a little sweet. Even the generous serving of thin pita chips with the hummus had a sweet taste. I like savory salty and dessert sweet.
I think we will continue frequenting Cheese Bar when in the neighborhood.

Great atmosphere, knowledgeable staff, and perfectly prepared food. Excellent cocktails to boot! We tried three dishes and six cocktails, plus two desserts. We were too full for a third! Excellent experience from start to finish, every visit has been consistently enjoyable.

We love Eatery A! Their pizza is phenomenal but definitely on the pricey side. Their happy hour for half-off pizzas and bottles of wine is from 3-6pm every day (including weekends!!). If we have a group of four or so, we all get our own pizza and trade pieces to try everything and split a couple bottles of wine.

This place can't be beat for happy hour deals!

Four stars because they nickle and dime for little things like asking for olive oil on the side to dip crust in.

This place was very neat. I went for brunch, and it was a bit of a slow say given the ongoing viral epidemic, but the food was excellent, the decor was tasteful, and the staff was attentive and kind. I hear this place also has a supreme happy hour, but I wouldn't know anything about it. I do recommend!

Worst dining experience. I always heard great things about Eatery A and was excited to try them out, especially after seeing they had a gluten free crust and dairy free cheese for their famous pizzas. While ordering I’m informed they are out of vegan cheese, not a big deal, but then find out their gluten free crust has dairy. So the waitress says you can either get the normal gluten crust without dairy or the gluten free with dairy. Neither of which I can have. Unfortunately, the rest of their menu is very limited for allergy sensitive people. I ended up a steak which was very undercooked and dangerous for me, which I didn’t realize at first since it was so dark in there. I was only able to barely eat half of my meal. Additionally, we brought out of town guests and after they ordered the waitress came back to inform us they were almost out of what one of them ordered so they could only do a half order (apparently they were out of everything that night). At the end of the meal the waitress tried to make our guests feel better by saying she only charged us for a half of the order instead of the full. Really? So they charged us for what they served us? Not sure how that makes it better. Lastly, the bar tender chugging beer and dropping f-bombs just added the cherry on top. If you have food sensitivities or allergies don’t go here. A very expensive bill for a very disappointing meal.

name: Harbinger
address: 2724 Ingersoll Ave, Des Moines, IA 50312, USA
reviews:
Last night was our first time eating at Harbinger. The setting is intimate with candles on the table, and minimal but rustic decor. The servers are very attentive, always making sure you have water. 

The food is delicious and small plate style. Follow the directions of the server and order a starter or two followed by one to two dishes per person and you'll leave feeling satisfied.

Everything is very vegetable forward but that's what I enjoyed the most. Elevating vegetables in the bleak landscape that is not only American, but Midwestern dining is a feat. 

We'll definitely be back at some point.

Our first time visiting Harbinger and we enjoyed it. Smaller, intimate space. Focus on quality- NOT quantity so be prepared for that. Staff 5 stars! Everyone kind, welcoming, helpful, etc. Really felt like they wanted us there. We didn't have reservations so just sat at the bar. Fun watching all the drinks being prepared. I had the butternut squash which was an absolute delight. BF had peking duck which was good- we both liked mine better. $60 for 3 drinks and 2 meals. The taste and quality were so wonderful- portion sizes quite small.  Anyway- fun last minute decision and good time. Glad we tried it!

Harbinger is an interesting place. I would definitely go once in a while for an experiential meal. My favorite aspect of the experience was the presentation of each dish and for a few of them I thought the flavours were really well orchestrated. The ambiance was not on par with the sophistication of the food. I would eat here again to see how things have progressed.

Phenomenal place. Easily the best food I've had in the area, and I appreciate the focus on vegetables/vegetarian dishes plus their efforts to highlight things you won't find at most other restaurants. Great service, and it's fairly reasonably priced if you take advantage of the happy hour deals!

Harbinger is one of the most delightful places to eat in Des Moines. Chef Joe Tripp is an absolute wizard with vegetables and they are the stars of his dishes. When meat is ordered he pairs it beautifully for a delicious explosion with every bite.

name: Farmhouse
address: 700 Locust St, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: I've been coming here on a regular basis since they opened up a few years back. The menu has evolved over time, but the food has stayed consistently great. If you're looking for a great breakfast or lunch spot, you've found it. It really is some of the best food in town. My only knock on the place is that they aren't open on the weekends.
Great food. Best burgers. Not even a close second. The burgers are so fresh. I don't usually have food cravings but when it comes to these burgers I need a fix about every 2-3 weeks.

Good food. Parking is rough. Went to pick up some food while my wife was in the hospital after having a baby. No where to park so had to park in the garage, but they didn't validate so had to pay $6 to stop and pick up food. Probably won't be heading back.

Best spicy chicken sandwich in town. Almost makes me not want to post a review to keep the line down. Friendly staff that always remain professional even during peak hours. Chorizo fries and fresh lemonade are my new favorite combination.
Everything was farm-to-market fresh at a fast food price! The spicy chicken sandwich is ten times better than Chick fil A IMHO!

name: Ritual Cafe
address: 1301 Locust Street STE. D, (located on 13th St. between Grand & Locust), Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: I don't usually go to vegetarian restaurants, but this place is great. The staff are incredibly kind, the environment is super cozy, and it just feels like a good cafe to grab breakfast and coffee and do a crossword puzzle. Feels like a great bookclub spot.

Very tasty and a great selection, especially if you are abiding by a vegetarian diet.  There was cheese so not full vegan but I am sure some items will fit the mold.  Coffee and lattes were excellent!  I had the po boi and it was extremely tasty

This restaurant is unquestionably one of the most attractive place in the area. Always when I go there I am deeply pleased. They maintain their high  level service and the topmost level of cooking  they serve. You definitely will enjoy this this restaurant. Very  recommended.

Quite a hipster place but it’s cute. I’m not vegetarian but I’m happy they have places like this 😁. They can also make anything on the menu vegan, which is great. I got the hummus toasted sandwich thing. Omg the bread was soooo soft. Wow. 🤤. I enjoyed everything about it. 😬
ALL VEGETARIAN!!! Friendly staff and great food. Fast service and awesome atmosphere.

name: Waterfront Seafood Market
address: 2900 University Ave, West Des Moines, IA 50266, USA
reviews: Wanting a change of pace from pork dishes (no offense, Iowa!), my husband and I came here to check out the seafood options to plan a nice dinner at home. The variety of options were amazing and the prices were very reasonable on nearly everything that caught our eye. I had intentions on picking up some scallops because I have a weak spot in my heart (and belly) for that, but after looking around more, we ended up choosing some large swordfish fillets. When we made dinner later, we didn't have to do anything elaborate to the swordfish in preparation - the flavor and texture was hearty and wonderful. I have heard fantastic things from numerous people who have eaten here, and will absolutely be back in the future to dine - but the market portion itself is worth checking out!
I'm no seafood connoisseur but I love their tartar sauce! Great service too, Jenny? even offered to get our drinks to go, which is a nice touch.

pros: service was good and the lobster was pretty good. Location in Ankeny was easy to get to. 
Cons: for being a seafood place I expected decent sea food. When shrimp is over cooked and the scallops are just okay, it’s pretty disappointing since that should be something your really good at when your a seafood place. With the high rating I expected more. The atmosphere was okay but I thought it would be a little nicer given the price of food. I will likely not go back unless I try the other location as I have heard that one is much different/ better.

A pretty darn good place to eat. Fresh seafood daily and fixed and presented beautifully.  I had Wild Gulf Shrimp, grilled. Delicious. Salmon looked beautiful..great pasta dishes too. You won't be sorry. Go early or you might have a wait.
Awesome food & the staff was great👍👏

name: Pho 515
address: 801 University Ave, Des Moines, IA 50314, USA
reviews: This little gem is tucked away in the corner of the market. Best pho I've had in the city. Get the crab rangoon as it's got the real thing in it. The seafood pho is the show stopper! Delicious and authentic
Very busy place and for good reasons. Food is phenomenal. prices are great. I always leave with left overs

Good portion of large Pho that won't break the bank.

Flavors of the Pho leans toward the sweeter side with sprinkle hints of star anise and cinnamon. The soup is clean and has an alright depth.

After finishing, it gets your mouth to the "I need some water" state.

Nice service and busy sometimes for seating.

For being tucked away in a Super Market, it is not a bad Pho.

This is one of the only places I go for Pho, and I've been to many across the Des Moines metro. It is by far the best. The service is always fast and friendly and it's always a reasonable price. Plus, I love that it is inside of an Asian grocery. Always fun to walk around and shop on a full stomach. :)
AWESOME PHO!!!! Best in Des Moines for sure! They have great Boba too and a selection of other awesome vietnamese dishes. It is in the front corner of the Asian grocery store.

name: Olympic Flame Restaurant
address: 514 E Grand Ave, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: Angelo provides an authentic Greek experience in their menu and restaurant decor. Recently I placed an order for our Easter dinner, he was generous. In his servings. And it was outstanding. Wonderful and delicious.

A small cozy place with nice people. I am in love with the lentil soup they serve. Honestly, I've never had a lentil soup as delicious as the make. The prices are very reasonable and portions are big enough. Great place in Des Moines!

Just got the simple gyro. Easily the most delicious gyro I've had in the area. The meat was tender and seasoned well, the tomato was extremely fresh, and the pita was extremely soft. The fries, on the other hand, were a little bland so I would recommend trying the Greek fries instead. Food came out very quickly and the staff was absolutely fantastic. I highly recommend visiting Olympic Flame!
Awesome little place in the the East Village. Authentic food, excellent service and some nice Greek wines! Highly recommend!
Quaint small space. Delicious authentic Greek food, wine, and beer. Incredible service every time.

name: Christopher's
address: 2816 Beaver Ave, Des Moines, IA 50310, USA
reviews: Wonderful experience with Christopher's for my wedding rehearsal dinner. My mother in law did a beautiful job planning and Christophers carried it out perfectly. Service was great, food was excellent. Thank you!
Toasted ravioli is really good and it’s only $10. Fried chicken and manicotti is a little bit pricey. Things are too salty. Soups are really good.
The service is always great. It's a family owned restaurant,  they remember you. Food is awesome.

Christopher’s has been around for years and I have eaten there many times over the last 20+ years. Though I had not been there for some time. Recently I had family in town that wanted to go there since they to had not been for years. We were greeted by friendly staff and made sure we had what we needed. The food did not disappoint, it was as good as it had always been. I did miss the dinner rolls they used to serve, the were great. Otherwise all was great!
Service was spectacular. Food was amazing. Drinks were strong. Great experience. I will return!

name: Lucca
address: 420 E Locust St, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: This pic is the Lucca salad. I typically order the primavera (with chicken); the noodles are amazing- cooked perfectly, the cream sauce and veggies are so fresh and their service is above and beyond, always. Ordered dinner to go once and they made the primavera (even though it's generally just on the lunch menu) and they threw in a slice of dessert to enjoy. This is easily one of my favorite restaurants.

This is a good find in Ames.  We were looking for dinner after a flight.  Came across this place on Goggle map with 4.7 rating.

It is a nifty setup in an elongated room.  The decor is pretty minimal yet comfortable.

The packaged menu has quite a few combo.  I started with just a standard Caesar salad.  Then followed by sausage risotto.  My big dish was scallops.  After that, a dessert tray!

All good stuff...

I had only eaten lunch here before, and it was always solid. When I finally had their little four course dinner, I was pleased as punch. I had one of the best pieces of salmon I've had in my life. Portions were pretty spot on. The pasta was excellent. Service was prompt. Limited bar was all we needed.  10/10 would go back.
Cozy spot for yummy Italian. Menu is prix fixe, and each course has a well-rounded list to choose from. Service is very good, understated but attentive.
Jen and I had new year's eve dinner at Lucca and had a great time. The food was superb, wine selections reasonably, and wait staff impeccable. Loved it! We'll be back!

name: Old West Mexican Restaurant
address: 4138 Fleur Dr #2324, Des Moines, IA 50321, USA
reviews: Superb margaritas. Standard Mexican fare in a western theme. Just as fast as anywhere else. I like to do carne asada tacos and they’re one of my favorite locations to get them. Would recommend over any other Mexican on the south side.

We just finished pickup....obviously Wild West Mexican prefers to keep our business during these difficult times and more  importantly they want our business when times are better. KUDOS to the Staff. OUR FOOD WAS GREAT!  Wanting our business after Covid-19 is not necessarily every restaurant 's  mission
Always great food. Staff is always super nice. The place is always busy, so you know it's good. Food is fast but not TOO fast, even when they are busy. Highly recommend!
Great lunch spot. This was my first time here and I enjoyed it. Service was super fast and friendly, food was delicious, atmosphere is great, and lunch pricing is spot on.

This is the best restaurant. They have excellent service and it is so fast, no matter what time of day or what you order, your drinks stay full and your food comes out hot. The food is yummy. My favorite appetizer is the Mexican guacamole. I also like that the tables aren't on top of each other. I'm a big woman and I can move around easily in the restaurant. Great place for a work lunch because of the speed!

name: Fat Tuesday
address: 6112 SW 9th St, Des Moines, IA 50315, USA
reviews: Absolutely wonderful. Our waitress Angel was top notch, answered all our questions. It might take a bit to get your food but that's because it's cooked up fresh. I definitely suggest this place if you want good cajun food.

Wonderful little hole in the wall type place!
Was nearby with a friend who recommended it and went to check it out. Food was amazing, everything from appetizers to entrees and sides.
We each had a Po'boy sandwich (blackened Shrimp for me and fried alligator for her) and the Cajun Bacon Mac & Cheese as our side.
Left completely full and even had leftovers to take home!
I love the place.  Great food.  I like to order the smothered catfish over jambalaya with a side of the jalapeno cornbread. Not really on the menu but perfect.  I  HIGHLY recommend this place.

It has to be a 5 star because you got it or not when you shrink a live music Cajun restaurant and wholesome food. Felt crowded at first then very comfortable. Real different atmosphere will definitely come back great experience.

We tried this place a few years ago and was very disappointed in the food. We decided to try it again, and OMG, what a difference. We ordered 3 types of sampler platters. Everything was delicious. Especially the frog legs!

name: Noah's Ark
address: 2400 Ingersoll Ave, Des Moines, IA 50312, USA
reviews: Always great food. Old school Italian still run by the family. From pasta to chicken wings (one of the few places that still sell the ENTIRE wing) to pizza to lobster to great desserts, Noah’s is still the one. We do mainly carry out, but try having a seat at the sunken bar. Great drinks & extensive wine list. Friendly service from managers, host & servers.

I was referred to Noah's Ark by the concierge at my hotel downtown in Des Moines. I'm so glad I went there! I arrived at opening during lunch. The menu is so big, so much to choose from! I ended up getting the Chicken Parmesan lunch special, I think it was 12.95. A great deal. First they brought out one of their famous garlicky love knots. Then I had a house salad with their famous creamy Italian dressing. It was a generous serving of salad, and it was good. The dressing was to die for! I don't usually like creamy Italian, but the waitress told me how good it was. She was right! It was amazing! I'll have to buy some next time I'm there. The Chicken Parmesan was delicious. It came with spaghetti and a very big Dinner Roll! That roll was like two rolls. The chicken parmesan had a little bit of bell pepper and onion in it, which I loved! After my meal I was too full for dessert. But the waitress gave me a complimentary bite of some delicious cheesecake! That was very nice of them to do that. A good way to get me to buy a big piece next time I'm there!

I admire this place! They offer tasty dishes, they have a nice menu, The chef in that restaurant is a specialist, I love a lot trying all their food. The food is always fresh and tasty, the attitude towards the customers  is very good too. I often go to  this place and I not even once was disappointed. I recommend it with no hesitation.

Based on the reviews I expected delicious food and good service. However, the best part was our server.  It was surprising that their vegetable side dishes were seemingly from a can and very overcooked.  The fruit salad - also from a can.  Their baked potato must be very popular as they had run out of them by 5pm.  The Spaghetti side was overcooked, very mushy and not drained that left a pool of water on the plate and which diluted the delicious sauce.  The Prime Rib was very undercooked for Medium Rare and was sinuous.  There was an old and limp piece of lettuce on the plate as decoration that is unnecessary and a waste.  One of the highlights was the Garlic Knot rolls provided prior to the meal.

I go to this excellent restaurant often  as I enjoy the good mood that is part of this place. The crew is highly loyal and skilfull. The service is certainly fast. Needless to say, the food they cook is magnificent. I have been there more than once and I was always delighted. The pay is decent. I recommend this place to to all.

name: Ohana Steakhouse
address: 2900 University Ave, West Des Moines, IA 50266, USA
reviews: I think the food is excellent. Service fast. The cooks put on quite a show while they prepare food. Seafood comes with a wide choice. Kid friendly. Congenial bar. Al staff smile and this is contagious with all customers looking happy.
Fantastic meal prepared for you. Heavenly rice & sauces. Celebrate Birthdays with photo for years.
Accidentally left 3 stars the first time. This place has great atmosphere and delicious food! Hoping to go back once this is all over.

I have been enjoying this restaurant for years. My all time favorite. ALWAYS amazing food and service. Go hungry, leave stuffed with leftovers and a smile. Scallops and calamari are two of my top favorites however, everything is phenomenal. Definitely a must have for any occasion.

We have been going to Ohana Steakhouse for many years.  It's our kids FAVORITE restaurant!  We love Cy and all his employees.  We highly recommend it, you won't be disappointed.  You will leave full and with a smile on your face!

name: Baratta's Restaurant
address: 2320 S Union St, Des Moines, IA 50315, USA
reviews: As soon as you walk in you know somehow you are going to have some great Italian food. Very unique location basically in the middle of a neighborhood. The bread that you start off with is fantastic. Soup or salad options are great. The server was always prompt with delivering our orders and the wine options were very reasonable. The pastas were so good! Can't go wrong with any of them. The dessert tray that they bring at the end looks so good I wish I could order every cake they have! The carrot cake was amazing though. And when we got our check at the end we were shocked at how affordable everything was. You'll love this place!

Delicious food. There was a party of 10+ seated beside us that were celebrating a birthday and insanely loud, and while there were other dining rooms, this was the one my parry of 2 was seated in. I wish they had started using other rooms to accommodate because I couldn't hear myself think for the entire meal. Certainly not our server's fault though.

The service was very good very friendly courteous helpful.
The appetizers were very good. Add steak and shrimp for supper excellent. Had a slice of red velvet cake for dessert most excellent.
I would have no hesitation to recommend this restaurant to anyone. Pleasant and friendly atmosphere.

Go here as often as I can.  The food is always incredible.  The service and ambience of the entire experience is what you expect in an old school Italian home.  I hope they are always going to be there to welcome us and feed us.
