The bar area is nice and the soup and bread was good, but they seated us in a drab area upstairs. Dipping oil wasn’t offered but is available upon request (I spotted another table with some) Eggplant was greasy and not good. Service was great. Prices are way to high for this quality. They did remove the charge for my meal which was very nice of them.

name: Maxie's Restaurant & Lounge
address: 1311 Grand Ave, West Des Moines, IA 50265, USA
reviews: This place is my preferable place.  Of all restaurants I know I love it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to that place. everytime  I I need a good lunch, this is the place that comes first to my head. extremely good and all sorts of  food and a large list of dishes.trained staff, and good spirit. In addition to that, the price is affordable. I sent my friends to this spot with great pleasure.

The last time I visited Maxie's they were still at the original location on Ingersoll. That must have been the early 1970s. Decided to try them out tonight. now I'm kicking myself for waiting so long. We pretty much had the place to ourselves probably because of the weather.
Ordered the combination breaded veggies ; onion rings, breaded mushrooms, fried pickles & fried green beans. All were hot, crisp and perfectly seasoned.
Dinner was a Rarebit burger and the white cheddar bacon jam Burger. Both burgers were prepared exactly as ordered. all of that plus a couple of glasses of half priced house wine and expert service made for a surprisingly awesome evening. Maxie's will definitely be a place we will visit often from now on.

My wife and I stopped in for lunch today. Comfort food from days gone by still being served up and the service was spot on.
 My wife mentioned we had never been here before but always wanted to stop. Our waitress and the other waitress both welcomed us . Hearing welcome to the family from the two of them really made our day.
 Thanks for great food and an amazing staff of employees .We will be back often. 

Mike and Julie Davis
It's a fair price for the food. Which is good but it's like dinner kinda food so it's what it is. But the staff is excellent and always happy and helpful.

I can't remember the last time I rated a restaurant so low.... no greeting when we came in, 3 employees went past us and no one greeted or offered to seat us. Finally someone sat us after more people came in behind us.  The waitress was fine at first, got our drinks and appetizer, but then she got a table of 8. She took their drink orders and got all of their drinks, then got their appetizer orders and served those, then went to get their dinner order. Never once between all of that did she check on us, bring out our meals, refill our empty drinks that were on the edge of the table.

Someone else brought our food out around the time she was starting their appetizer orders and the fries and onion rings were cold so it had obviously been sitting in the back for awhile.  I also didn't get the salad with house dressing that I'd asked for.  

When I saw her taking the dinner orders at the other table, I sighed and said something to my son and then someone else that was walking by  finally over - I think he heard me.  I asked him for refills on our cups and told him the sides were cold and that I just wasn't hungry anymore.  I did NOT ask for a discount, I just wanted something to drink and to leave.

Neither of us finished our meals and for the first time that I can remember we left the food and didnt even bring it home for left overs or to feed to our chickens.... 

The appetizer was good, my ton said he liked the baked potato.  Cold fries and onion rings on my plate - well those are never good cold.  My meal was, egh.  

The guy that refilled our water asked if we wanted the check, I said yes and I have no idea why he asked if I wanted two checks when I was having dinner with my 13 year old son.  That was odd.  He made a point of telling me that he took the appetizer off the bill (since my dinner was cold??)  I said that wasn't necessary, paid and left.

I wouldn't go back.  I saw other great reviews but to have a waitress completely ignore us for that long, cold food, leaving a salad off... Simply not worth my money.

name: Gateway Market Cafe
address: 2002 Woodland Ave, Des Moines, IA 50312, USA
reviews: Wow! Wonderful selection of mouth-watering menu items fit for every taste.  I feared for a long wait in the Sunday lunch rush but our food came out fast and delicious!  Pick up your groceries on the way out!

The cafe has an extraordinary, organic menu with a comfortable setting. Gateway Market Cafe is adjacent to the unique Gateway Market which sells wine, cheese, flowers, groceries, and locally sourced gifts.
From the street Gateway appears to be just the market. The Cafe makes it definitely worth the visit!

Love this place. It's close to the interstate which for a traveler like me is great. Could use more parking, always good and reasonably priced food, and when I have time I shop. I've had food delivered from here having all the places in the city to choose from. It's Cafe style, it works!
Good food. Great options for a quick dinner or going to the grocery store for different items that you won't find at places like Hy vee or Wal Mart. Good location.

The food is excellent. Process are good also. I had the steak tacos and they were very taste. Along with me a friend had the pad Thai and loves it and the other friends had a salad and loved it and the dressing. I would highly recommend.

name: Miyabi 9
address: 512 E Grand Ave, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: Absolutely amazing place. The staff were extremely welcoming and thankfully weren't hover waiters. The food was delicious and you get a lot of bang for your buck. The atmosphere is also amazing containing many Japanese products from a large traditional kimono they have hang on a wall along a Noh mask, to the little knickknack here and there placed thought the store. Gives you a real feeling of visiting somewhere in Japan from the middle of Iowa
Always a class act! Professional sushi at good prices in a friendly atmosphere. Always my favorite place in Des Moines to get sushi. Took our 10 year old and he loved every bite.

Every time I come here I am served promptly and with kindness. Cozy hole-in-the-wall feels, with a warm, classy ambiance. The owner is extremely kind and accommodating - as well as the servers. Not to mention the sushi is well crafted, fresh, and always hits the spot. 10/10 would recommend. 😇

My wife and I went on a dinner date to miyabi 9 and had a wonderful time. we were well taken care of in all aspects of our service with some complimentary service being that it was our first time and we were blown away at the quality and craftsmanship that they put into their sushi as well as their desserts. The restaurant itself is quaint and very cozy and clean. we ate at the bar which we don't typically do but really enjoyed it watching and communicating with the chefs.  We will most certainly be heading back there in the near future because we left so satisfied. We would highly recommend Miyabi 9 for sushi over the many other options in the metro area.

I was leaving my friend’s birthday sleepover and realized I had locked my keys in my Jeep. While waiting for roadside assistance, I ventured down the street to find something to eat. Alas, I find myself in front of Miyabi 9. I sat at the bar, having the ability to watch the sushi being prepared. The owner was working, busily creating wonderful works of art as I watched in absolute awe. He personally took my order of smoked salmon and yellowtail tuna. Absolutely melt in my mouth, fresh seafood. It was utopian bliss for my palate. I also ordered a serving of the mini spring rolls, apparently looking so incredibly appetizing, the woman sitting next to me placed an order of her own! I will definitely return!—I believe locking my keys in the car was fate. 🍣 I’d give Miyabi 9 five THOUSAND stars if I could!

name: Chuck's Restaurant
address: 3610 6th Ave, Des Moines, IA 50313, USA
reviews: My family and I decided to try something new and chose Chucks! We came in last Saturday, while the restaurant was quite busy we were offered the choice of the music room - the room was fairly busy but we were seated immediately. Our server Kelsey greeted us right away with waters and assured us wait times may take a little longer. We weren’t sure what to order, she recommended several of her favorites, we chose mozzarella sticks and wings to get started. They were  DELICIOUS. Great portions. Kelsey continued following up with us, refilling our drinks & making sure we were happy, she had a great attitude, kept smiling (which is a big deal to have a continuous smile and bubbly personality to me). She was very busy, having several other tables and rooms. We ended the night with a chicken fettuccine, a spinach ravioli, and a large buffalo chicken pizza. All was worth the wait! Very great tasting food, good pricing and great people!! Will be back soon!

I've always driven past this place but never thought I'd ever go in. My boyfriend and I decided to try something new, and since this was right down the street from us, we ended up choosing this place. Best. Food. Ever! I ordered the Bruschetta Burger and was so impressed. My boyfriend ordered wings and spinach ravioli in alfredo sauce. Alfredo sauce is always a hit or miss with me but when I tried some of it from his plate... amazing! These people are so friendly and definitely know how to make food.

We met friends for pizza at Chuck's recently and thoroughly enjoyed it! Great pizza and onion rings, tremendous service and perfectly mixed cocktails. The place isn't fancy, but is reminiscent of a classic 1960s neighborhood restaurant. We had the "Everything" pizza and it was superb! Last Friday my friend and I made a late evening trip to Chucks for pizza. It was delicious! We had some onion rings as an appetizer. They were thin and crispy and so tasty! Our waiter was right on top of things. I highly recommend this restaurant!!
Great food and service. Very good portion size. I’ll Definitly return.
This spot is worth giving a shot. They have large portions for reasonable rates. Constantly clean and with excellent vibes. Will visit here again.

name: The High Life Lounge
address: 200 SW 2nd St, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: Ginnchiest place in Iowa!! How can you NOT love this place?? Great Beer and Food. Super cool place to hang out on a Sunday afternoon... I will visit again!!

Food was absolutely delicious!  Perfectly prepared!  My tenderloin was crisp, but tender, not overbreaded or overcooked!  Fries were perfect, not burnt. Loved my meal, and Bloody Mary drink was outstanding, beautiful to see and refreshing to drink. Also, great place for a conversation.

I don't know how they managed to make this relatively new bar feel so perfectly divey. The food, the music, everything was on point. Great comfy bar to hang out and drink in for a while. The chicken was salty, crispy and delicious.
What a great dive with good service and good food. Worth a visit. Try the fried cheese curds and the Lil Smokies.

The bacon-wrapped tator tots are the best! Atmosphere is old school... Takes me back to my childhood. Only drawback is it's always busy... That and it would be nice if you could get the beers from next door El Bait Shop!

name: Waveland Cafe
address: 4708 University Ave, Des Moines, IA 50311, USA
reviews:
Really warm and comfy atmosphere. The dine in can’t fit up to 45 people. Plenty of space but when it’s the rush hour, you might have to come in early as there will be a line. Trust me, the food is worth the wait :) 

The food being serve here are delicious (specially for the affordable price), you have to try out their Waveland’s beat skillet! It’s delicious and well season! It’s a decent size for one person serving but not to worry cause you can always order anything you want in the menu half the size. My favorite food here is their hash brown, it’s golden brown crunchy on the outside and soft in the middle, super delicious ! 

There limit parking on the front of the dine in but you can park on the street. It’s usually a very short walk to the restaurant. 

It’s a family friendly restaurant and the waitresses here are super friendly and sweet. If you have any questions at all they will have the answer waiting for you. They serve they food hot and fast! If you’re hungry, there won’t be a long wait right after placing your order. 

Hope you enjoy this dining restaurant!

It was a great visit.  I'm visiting from New Orleans and love a good diner/cafe breakfast.  My cousin suggested Waveland Cafe.  It's in a quiet residential area and seems to be a popular spot.  I had pancakes n hashbrowns. Molly was a great server and took her time to make sure my order was to my liking. The food was delicious and the place was nice
Great food! This was my 1st time visiting and it was extremely busy but in a good positive way...the employees were doing the best they could to manage. I would visit and suggest this place again

Waveland Cafe is riding the crest of public approval these days and for good reasons! Good food, friendly service, hometown character and history.  My only complaint about the "skillet" meal was that it looked and tasted like an omelet over hash browns. Where's the skillet? Parking is a hassle even if you get a space out front - then it's hard to get out. Even so it was a full cafe at 10 am on Tuesday.
Always great good and great service. I'm from a rural community and the Waveland is just like home. Cozy, comfortable, and hoppin'!

name: La Mie Elevate
address: 601 Locust St, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: Great place to pick up something quick and there are healthy options. My favorite dishes are the veggie scramble, Cajun tuna sandwich, salmon Cesar salad and the gyro pizza. I honestly haven't had anything I've disliked. The desserts are divine too - try the macaroons!!!
service wasn't great. food was decent but got the complete wrong drink initially. 2 of the 4 macarons were broken

Had the lemon shrimp grain bowl and the shrimp was amazing! There wasn't quite the lemon flavor I expected. Also, maybe a total of a quarter cup of grains in the bowl. Small flaws in an otherwise great meal.

been going here since they opened. I love their Turkey club. Then last week go in for one and was told that all they had left was what was on top of the coolers for sandwiches. Mind you the sandwiches are just on metal platter ON TOP of the coolers. My daughter has went by at 8 AM and they are out there. So I want a fresh one. She wouldn't make one. After a few weeks ago when my supervisor had a sandwich with a bite out of it and had to go back and tell them about it... don't think they should be turning away business. I won't be back. too many places downtown to go to eat that will make fresh items from their menu. Maybe  they should say we won't fix things fresh off the menu any longer???!  just serve the warm sandwiches on the coolers... ick!
The food is dang good, and I got a nice sized sandwich.  Service was quick, too.

name: Fawn's Asian Cuisine
address: 1107 E University Ave, Des Moines, IA 50316, USA
reviews: We absolutely love this place. In fact, they closed just before the holidays and we were lost. The food is always fresh and warm. So good. The best pho in the area.

Fawn's Asian Cuisine is a small stand-alone restaurant. We got there right when they opened on Saturday morning at 11 am. We didn't have a reservation, but they were quickly able to seat six of us easily.

I started with their crab rangoons. They were really large, freshly made and had a very crisp shell. For my entree, I ordered the combination Lo Mein. The flavor of the sauce was fresh & gingery!  The noodle dish contained large pieces of beef, chicken, and generously-sized prawns. It was a huge portion, and I was able to take half of it home.

Great prices, and great food!

This place always pleases me. Nice choices of curries, pho or traditional Chinese . Lunches include soup, egg roll and entree. I had a tasty beef and snow peas and my buddy had chicken red curry- both were excellent.

Amazing Pho! This was my first time here and I lived it. Service was super fast and extremely friendly. I had P6(chicken). The broth was very flavorful and the chicken was grilled to perfection. Will definitely be back!

From the first moment  you come to this restaurant  they give you a nice feeling. Very courteous hosts, it is a kind restaurant to  pass time with friends or with your date. Great  food, qualified  chief cook and stuff, decent  pay and nice  service. Warmly recommended.

name: Tequila Restaurant & Cantina
address: 2824 Easton Blvd, Des Moines, IA 50317, USA
reviews: Our favorite neighborhood restaurant. The fajitas are awesome, and the husband has several favorites too. Chips and salsa while you wait is the perfect appetizer. ❤
Hands down my favorite restaurant. The food is always GREAT and the staff is so friendly. Even through this pandemic and having to take the orders to go, it is just as good!

We arrived on a whim. Driving around at 7 PM on a Friday night looking for a decent place to eat. We drive by Tequila and decided to give it a try. It was a cozy, family-owned place with booths and tables. I ordered a Strawberry Daiquiri and he a Diet Pepsi. The salsa was nice and fresh and the queso runny, but very good. The entree came quickly. You order by number here, although it is a sit down restaurant with menus. I got #42 Shredded Beef Burrito and he the (forgot #) Tequila Burrito. Both we very good and pretty much the stand faire Mexican. However, he also ordered the Mexico City Taco which was to die for. And he said he'd order a plate full next time instead of just the one. Giving 4 stars because everything was adequate +, but a little lacking on friendliness. We intend to come back, although wouldn't make it a priority.

The ladies up front are so friendly and helpful and the food is fantastic. Everything is fresh and affordable, the margaritas are strong, and the interior is warm and comfortable. Definitely the best food and service on the East side.

Best Mexican food around. I grew up in so cal and this is the closest to that style of food I have found. This is my new #1 favorite Mexican food restaurant . The inside is nothing fancy but the food is good and the service is great.

name: Drake Diner
address: 1111 25th St, Des Moines, IA 50311, USA
reviews: Good food Good Service. This place has the old diner feel and look with Neon signs to boot. Breakfast to dinner options available all day. The bar is stocked but I would suggest the malts and or shakes. You can get a beer anywhere. A nicely made malt with the extra metal cup can make any day great.

Excellent 50's-style restaurant with a traditional American menu from burgers, soups and sides.

Both booth and bar-style seating is available.  The service is fast and friendly.  Very popular among locals and a great place to experience if you are just visiting.

The diner can be found near Drake University.

Plan some extra time it's not fast. Our server wasn't paying attention and kept saying our order wrong. At the end he brought what he wanted not what we ordered. Told him three times we didn't get a shake. Never got it but was charged. They corrected it at the register. The food that we got was really good. It's worth a try. I hope you have a better experience then we did. Keep in mind the food was good.
Great landmark with perfect diner menu. Happy staff. Upbeat atmosphere and excellent blue plate specials. KILLER MILK SHAKES. particularly exceptional sweet potato fries.
Really has a nostalgic feel! Staff is friendly, prices are fair, and serving size is generous. And - they have peanut butter and jelly sandwiches for hard to please children! Highly recommended.

name: Tsing Tsao South
address: 4230 Fleur Dr, Des Moines, IA 50321, USA
reviews: Most times food is not bad and when you like their food everything is wonderful but when something is done wrong they instantly blame the customer. I have ate there many times over the past year and the quality has diminished. Today was not pleasant.. the chicken was bland, gravy juice was so funny that it completely leaked out before we got home. Disappointed, not that they will care.

Best sesame chicken ever. I get it Everytime and it never disappoints. You get good portions for the lunch special plus you get soup, egg roll, and crab Rangoon. Clean and very friendly staff. Chicken is lightly breaded unlike hyvee. Much more quality and value compared to Hy-Vee Chinese.

I order the food and have it delivered, when the person got to my door, my food fall out the bag, he say the paper already kind of wet when he picked up. So I call restaurant and let them know, they told me is not their fault,  after talks to them for few minutes on the phone. They told me to give all the food to the guy to bring it back and they will him get us the new one, an hours later, we never got our food! I can't believe this is how they treat the customer. Try to call them , they did not answer.

Love the service! The cashier lady is a hoot! Food is great and fast. The staff is very attentive even if they are busy. Love their egg rolls and fried rice. Place is always busy so you know it's liked. Highly reccomend.
Inexpensive and good food. A very good value and people are very friendly

name: Open Sesame
address: 313 E Locust St, Des Moines, IA 50309, USA
reviews: Pretty tasty food in a great environment. The falafel is a bit less crunchy/crispy than you’ll find at similar restaurants, but that’s not necessarily a bad thing. I had the falafel salad and it was very flavorful and filling. Service was quick and I enjoyed the lighting and atmosphere.
The food was fresh, the meat was tender, and the Hummus was fabulous. Our waiter Brandon was very nice, and even gave me a piece of baklava for my birthday. This place is a must!
This little restaurant is absolutely perfect!  It’s small and quiet fit the romantic feel.  It offers a wide variety of wonderful dishes as well.  Wonderful wine selection too!
As an Arab guy, THIS IS NOT AN ARABIC FOOD. And really so far away from being called Lebanese cuisine. I don’t know what cuisine this is, but it sucks. If there’s less than one star I’ll put it.
Fresh delicious food! Much like Greek food with pitas, gyros, salads, wraps and basmati rice plates. Small place but definitely worth the visit!
